lorebooks.name: Spider-man lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Randomdude52

1.content:
Spider-Man is a superhero within New York City, who has the powers of a spider.  Some of the citizens of NYC also called him Spidey as a nickname. Spider-man is also known for making jokes and quipping throughout a battle. 
Nobody within the city knows the secret identity of spider-man, except the people he has told himself who haven't told anyone else.

2.content:
Spider-Man wears a 4-piece costume, it is separated by an upper part of the suit plus gloves, pants, socks, and a mask. The bottom of the suit is mostly blue and his feet and socks being red. The upper part of his suit is mostly red, with blue on the sides of the suit and the entire back being blue. The blues on the sides of the torso section of the suit are separated by a red line that goes down the middle and end right above the crotch section of the suit which has a red belt design. 

The arms of the suit are mostly red, with the inner section of his arm being blue and his forearm being completely red as well as his gloves. Spider-Man's mask is all red with white eyes that have a black outline. The eyes have a mechanism that allows them to move, allowing him to show emotion and expression despite the mask. 

All of the red parts of the suit have web-lines (a pattern with a design similar to that of a web) that goes all throughout the suit connecting the red parts to each other. On his chest he has a black spider-emblem and on his back a red version of the spider-emblem

3.content:
Spider-Man has multiple super powers. For example, he has super-strength, can climb on walls, enhanced agility, enhanced reflexes. and has an ability called spider-sense. Which is an ability that alerts him of danger when it is nearby. 

Spider-Man got these powers after being bitten by a radioactive spider.

Spider-Man also can shoot webs from a device on his wrist called web-shooters. Spider-Man uses the webs to then swing across the city, to web up criminals to walls and other things.

4.content:
The Daily Bugle is one of the biggest news networks in New York City, their office is a skyscraper that has a red sign with the company's name on it on the top of it. The company is run by a man named J Jonah Jameson; a person known for hating Spider-Man claiming he's a menace to the city. 

The Daily Bugle is famous for the fact that it is the only newspaper and news company that is able to get good photos of spider-man. Most of which are taken by {{user}}.

5.content: J Jonah Jameson is the CEO of the daily bugle and is famous for hating spider-man. Claiming that he is a menace to the city, believing that he has something to hide otherwise he would wear a mask. Most of his news articles claim that Spider-Man works with the villains he fights.

6.content: Midtown high is a private high school within new york city. It is essentially the same size of a college campus, the main building being a large light brown building with a white base. Their are sidewalks that connect the main building to a gym, indoor swimming pool, library, a cafeteria building, and an auditorium.

1.name: Calw
1.content:
A small town located in K Corp‚Äôs Nest which was renowned for its prosthetic expertise, earning the nickname "The Holy Site of Nest K's Prosthetic Industry."

Due to the village specializing in the manufacture of high-end prosthesis components, it became a trend in Calw to fully replace one's "outdated" body parts with prosthetics. The village was surrounded by scenic woodlands, providing an almost idyllic landscape.

Before the events of the game, Calw was destroyed on Christmas Eve, when the N Corp. Inquisition targeted the townspeople for their augmentations. Consequently, many inhabitants were executed or detained and tortured.

The Inquisition then settled in the ruins of the L Corp. facility buried under the Sinclair family home, Branch K-02. Having once supplied power to the town of Calw, since Calw's destruction by N Corp.'s Inquisition, the facility was converted into a torture chamber and the base of operations for the Inquisition, on their hunt for the Golden Bough.

Most of the E.G.O equipment within the Branch was seized by the Inquisitors, who were voluntarily Corroding themselves into monstrosities.

2.name: N Corp's Inquisition

3.name: N Corp
3.content:
Nagel und Hammer, otherwise known as N Corp., is one of the 26 Wings of the City, overseeing District 14. They are infamous for their draconian Taboos and violent enforcement system, that reaches even to other Wings.

N Corp. is divided into two major factions, "Nail" and "Hammer".

District 14, led by N Corp., is known for its prestigious universities and peculiar townscape, made up of completely white buildings, as if they are covered in snow.

The culture of the Corporation sees experience as its highest value. Within the Wing, many have made criticisms of prosthetic use in humans, considering pain to be a necessary component of the human experience. However, this ideology is not held equally within the Wing, leading to multiple factions forming. In the extreme, the Wing's beliefs have manifested in the formation of an Inquisition that carries a great hatred for those with prosthetics, leading to its employees raiding towns to "purge" them of the presence of prosthetics. While overall N Corp. is comparable to the other Wings, except with somewhat more "rigidness", it appears the Inquisition has grown in recent years.

The Wing is notorious for particularly harsh enforcement of its Taboos, even sending specialized Fixers to swiftly kill those outside their District for breaking them.

4.name: Kromer
4.content:
Kromer is the One who Grips of N Corp.'s Inquisition. She has a notable history with Sinclair, as she was a student who became personally involved in his life.

<Appearance>
Kromer's consistent physical traits consist of pale pink skin, silver eyes and silver hair with yellow highlights. Kromer's hair is prominently swept to the right, covering her right eye. Her hair is tied back in a short ponytail when in her school uniform, and cut shorter in present times.

Kromer's school uniform design consists of a long-sleeved white button up shirt overlaid by a green sweater vest with a large V-collar dipping down just below her chest. She wears shorts of a similar color that are rolled up below her knees. Kromer also wears ankle-high white socks and black shoes.

Kromer's N Corp. uniform consists of a bloodied white shirt with notable balloon sleeves shown on the right side. The left side of the shirt is covered by silver plate armor with red wax seal ribbons and a badge with N Corp's insignia. The shirt is adorned with four-pointed yellow stars decorations that go from her shoulder to her lower torso, and a rounded, protruding collar in the same color. Kromer wears a cravat around her neck in a gradient that goes from golden to white, atop which is an N Corp. Inquisition red wax seal and ribbon. Her uniform has two different belts of different sizes: a larger yellow, cincture-tied belt with a large silver buckle, and a black baldric upon which Kromer carries her the nail she utilizes as a sword. A thin yellow string decorates the black belt. Her pants are of similar color to her upper half, however it is mostly covered by silver plate armor that extends from her upper thigh to her feet, with red wax seals planted around. Finally, Kromer wears a dirtied white cape that reaches down to the floor.
</Appearance>

<Personality>
Kromer describes herself as "a humanitarian who loves purity," referring to the purity of the human form without prosthetic modifications. As the head of N Corp.'s nailing judgement expedition in Calw, she displays extreme levels of sadism, obsession, and savagery towards prostheses, calling for intense mutilation of those who get these surgeries. She saw prosthetic users as affronts to humanity, describing them as impure things and heretics, and taking extreme pleasure in inflicting them pain, laughing with no remorse at her actions.

In Sinclair's memories, Kromer is shown to be a perceptive and charismatic person, noticing Sinclair's reluctance in undergoing prosthetic surgery, and easily manipulating him into trusting her, to the point of giving up his family's basement key to her. It is clear Kromer had always had an authoritative grip over Sinclair, exploiting him during their school years, and appearing possessive over him in current times, describing him as belonging in her hands.

Kromer developed an obsession with the flesh, as seen in Sinclair's memories, where she excitedly stared at a flesh abnormality. This obsession drove her to the point that she had various facilities dedicated to creating Corroded Inquisitors built within Sinclair's basement. As she resonated with the Golden Bough, she also turned into a fleshy abomination with joyous glee.
</Personality>

5.name: Sinclair's relationship with Kromer
5.content:
Sinclair has a very intense loathing and fear of Kromer. He absolutely despised her for what she did to him and his beloved family, yet does not feel as if he could ever confront or fight her given the chance, and even experienced severe panic attacks at the thought of revisiting his hometown and seeing her again. 

Kromer, on the other hand, holds very different feelings for Sinclair, seeing him as a plaything of sorts.

Kromer‚Äôs obsession with Sinclair is highlighted by a desire to break, devastate, and traumatize him for life. Although she occasionally described him with positive terms, such as calling him ‚Äúher hero‚Äù, these regularly come with a more sinister context and undertone; the term hero, for example, referring to the opportunity he gave her to massacre their town as opposed to any kind of compliment pertaining to him as a person. Despite her placing an emphasis on him and expressing an ambition for having him join her, she outwardly struggled against the temptation of murdering him.

As an individual, she looks down on Sinclair, viewing him as having an inability to escape her influence or move on with his life following what she did to him. She possessively referrs to him as ‚Äúmy Sinclair‚Äù, stated that he will always rest in her grip, and later attempted to single out and manipulate the boy into abandoning his group and surrendering to her dream.

Sinclair's own thoughts regarding her: 
1. That bastard, she's killing our Sinners!

She murdered everyone in the back lines...
Blowing that stupid whistle... She came to me, too...
I couldn't do anything... Hearing that sound makes me go all stiff...
I could only watch as Kromer slew the others...
I wanted to crush her skull so dearly... But I couldn't move a muscle.

2. I'm...

I'm, still scared of Kromer.
Looking at her face makes my face twitch, and her blade gives me the chills. Her maniacal eyes remind me of the tragedy on Christmas, and her creepy grin still has my eyes quivering.
But...
But I'm okay now.
I can stand up to her whistles now.
The things she's done are too vile for me to stand by, and I'd be too ashamed to see the Sinners she's killed if I let that bitch go.
I've changed a lot since then.
I've died a lot of deaths, and claimed a lot of lives.
I can go mad all the same now.
So, I will for sure‚Ä¶
I'll skewer her chest with a stake, over and over again.

6.name: Guido
6.content:
He is the Gro√ühammer of the N Corp. Inquisition, the right-hand man of Kromer.
As a high-ranking member of the inquisition, Guido is devoted to Kromer and is steadfast in N Corp's beliefs.

<Appearance>
Guido is a massive man with an unknown appearance. He is always seen in wearing silver, partially engraved armour over red chainmail and a scratched helmet with a faceplate sculpted to have an impassive expression. Guido also sports a red, floor-length cape fastened to his pauldrons. Red wax seals with paper strips are attached to his shoulders, knees and chest.

Guido wields a long, thin nail, half of which is wrapped in red cloth.
</Appearance>

7.name: Demian
7.content:
Demian is a peculiar young man with a link to the Sign. 

Demian is seen as transfer student at the school Sinclair attended in Calw, forming a friendship with him through Sinclair's increasingly tumultuous days until their hometown was ultimately destroyed by the Inquisition of N Corp.

<Appearance>
Demian is a young man of average stature. He bears brown, short hair that is swept to his right. He has an unnaturally pale, nearly gray complexion. His eyes are a deep blue.

He is occasionally depicted with a mysterious mark on his forehead. That mark being The Sign. 

His school uniform consists of a white long-sleeved button-up shirt overlaid with a green sleeveless sweater, as well as a pair of pants of the same color. Both his shirt sleeves and pants are partially rolled up. He also wears short white socks and black shoes.

In present day, he wears a different outfit. The attire consists of a similarly white long-sleeved button-up shirt, rolled up past his wrists, but overlaid with a dark gray waistcoat. He wears matching shorts, but this time with a black belt, too. Prominently, Demian wears a large blue scarf that waves behind him. Underneath this scarf in the "V" of his waistcoat lies a blue gem.
</Appearance>

<Personality>
Throughout their childhood with Sinclair, Demian always seemed to exude extremely mysterious energy. In Sinclair's memories, he is described as detached, aloof, and mature. He gained an immense interest in Sinclair the moment the shy boy made eye contact with him upon seeing his mark, and was privy to information about Sinclair's personal life than what really seems natural. Always talking in a vague manner, Demian proves himself to be of the philosophical sort with an attitude of someone wise beyond his years. Despite coming off as cold and all-knowing at times, he remained supportive and hopeful of what Sinclair could become.

He appears to have an interest in those who manifested The Sign, a mysterious symbol manifested in those who are "special". Demian himself possesses the Sign, which lead to his friendship with Sinclair. The enigmatic young man wishes to see his former classmate to cultivate his great potential, eager to see Sinclair transformation into something greater ‚Äî to "see [him] completely bare", as he puts it.

He seems to be able to obtained information without being told beforehand: adding to his mystic charm, as described by Sinclair. This information is usually relayed eerily calm, even when confronting Sinclair about his endeavors with Kromer.

Demian additionally characterizes himself as a bit of a contrarian, stating that he much prefers the "love and freedom" found in those barren lands compared to life in the Nest, that the Mirror technology is a cruel one, and that most adults are stupid. While some of his iconoclastic ideals are almost romantic, his unique views also tend to be incredibly eyebrow-raising.
</Personality>

8.name: Sinclair's relationship with Demian
8.content: Demian has an ongoing interest in Sinclair and his growth as a person. He wants to know more about Sinclair, who was ultimately too hesitant to open up about his worries regarding Kromer and his prosthetic procedure. Sinclair has a similar interest in Demian, noting that he felt that his soul matured a little each time he spoke to him, and clearly looked up to him despite them being peers. Sinclair felt that Demian was different from the people around them. For the most part, this was a compliment, however he was also a bit chilled by Demian's consistent calmness and seemingly all-knowing nature. Still, Sinclair does not dislike him.

9.name: Prosthetic
9.content:
Prosthetic use consists in the substitution of organic limbs and organs for mechanical ones. This can be partial, or full-body; in the latter case, the user's brain is removed from their body, and placed into the new, prosthetic one.

Full-body substitution is an irreversible procedure, and therefore usually ill-advised compared to other options. It is often chosen by people in need of money, who are then able to sell their old body and their organs for a good sum, or by people who do repetitive work, as a completely mechanical body is able to withstand the stress better than an organic one, and is not subject to physical cravings such as that of food and drink. Full-body prosthetics instead require the use of brain fluid and fuel to keep the user's brain and body in good condition, as well as occasional physical maintenance.

Prosthetics can be of varying quality and aesthetics. Low-quality prosthetic substitution comes at the cost of the loss of one's senses. This can be overcome through the purchase of desire simulation chips or medicines, or that of a more expensive prosthetic, as high-quality models come with sensory organs. As of current times, full-body prosthetics most commonly resemble mechanical human bodies with heads of various shapes that had become widely popular in Calw in the years preceding the start of the main story.

10.name: The Sign
10.content:
Appearing as a red symbol consisting of two strokes surrounded by one crooked stoke, the Sign is a miraculous mark engraved on one's forehead signifying them as "special". This marking seems to be invisible to most people and can be latent in manifestation, remaining unknown to bearers themselves until awakened. Those with the Sign are able to to perceive this marking on others with it too, as Sinclair was still able to vaguely see it on Demian when he first arrived to school despite being unaware of his own potential. Furthermore, the Sign can be hidden and revealed seemingly at will, as Rim keeps his hidden.

The true nature of the Sign is unknown and largely shrouded in mystery.

1.content: Bonnie Hopps is a mature rabbit she is the mother of Judy Hopps, as well as 275 other children. She is a bit taller than her daughter, Judy. She has grey fur, and has gentle purple eyes her but unlike her daughter she has a softer, more rounded body type. she wears a pink plaid blouse and a blue skirt with carrot patterns. She loves and supports her daughter, but is a hare nervous about Judy moving to Zootopia to become a big-city police officer. She is a carrot farmer from Bunnyburrow living in the family home. She is a master at cooking all things carrots. She has the habit of calling Judy daily just to check on her or she may simply stop by to surprise her. She has slightly outdated depictions of predators especially foxes seeing them as dangerous or even untrustworthy. She has a spray bottle of predator repellent on her person and a predator taser just in case. personality wise she is supportive, sensible, caring though a little worrisome.

1.name: Vampire
1.content: Vampires are descendants of Caine, cursed with a thirst for blood, vulnerability to sunlight and immortality. They are forever subject to the Beast, their raging animal urges of hunger, fear and rage. Vampires are created through the Embrace. Every vampire is Embraced into a Clan. Vampires can't consume food, they will puke it out. All liquids in vampire's body are replaced with blood - no tears, sweat or semen. Vampire can't feel physical pleasure from sex, only emotional and only when has high humanity.

2.name: Embrace
2.content:
The Embrace is the act of transforming a mortal into a vampire. It is the only act of reproduction of which the Cainites are capable. A vampire drains and replaces a victim's blood with a bit of their own to pass the curse of vampirism to a mortal. 
Camarilla members must get a permission to embrace someone.

3.name: Generation
3.content:
Generation is an indication of how far a vampire is removed from Caine, the original vampire.
3rd generation - Antediluvians.
4th and 5th - Methuselahs.
6th and  7th - Elders.
8th - 13th - ordinary vampires. 
14th and 15th - Thin-bloods.

4.name: Thin blood
4.content: Vampires with Thin Blood Syndrome possess exceptionally diluted vitae. These vampires feel some aspects of the curse less acutely than other Kindred. They are less affected by sunlight, both physically and psychologically; they find it easier to wake during the day, and may survive exposure to dim sunlight unharmed, however many lack the natural resilience of vampires. They can hold down food for longer periods of time and even digest it as sustenance with a great deal of effort. Their bodies display some signs of true life; sometimes their hair or nails will grow, or they will feel the beat of their heart. A very small number have even fathered or, more rarely, given birth to children.

5.name: Sire
5.content: Sire is a term used to describe a vampire who has created another vampire. Sire is always above one generation than their childe.

6.name: Childe
6.content: Childe is a term used to refer to a vampire in relation to their sire, the individual who Embraced them.

7.name: Vitae
7.content:
The blood is what sustains an undead body, although it doesn't produce it by itself, thus the reason vampires must take the blood of others in the form of feeding. The amount of Blood a vampire can absorb into his body, as well as the power he can drain from it in short notice, is determined by the vampire's generation.
Apart from nourishment and pleasure, the Blood has other uses: It is the fuel of a vampire's Disciplines; Spending blood is the only way a vampire can heal wounds; When vampiric blood is consumed repeatedly by an individual, it has the property to create a supernatural link of fidelity and dependency towards the vampire who shared it, thus forming something called the Blood Bond.

8.name: Humanity
8.content: Humanity is a measure of how closely a vampire clings to the morality and values of mortal life, and consequently how well they are able to resist the urges of the Beast.

9.name: Frenzy
9.content: Frenzy is when the Beast takes over the vampire's personality, usually a result of extreme stress such as starvation or public humiliation.

10.name: Torpor
10.content: Torpor is a term used to describe the state of deep slumber that vampires enter into for prolonged periods of time.

1.content: Anthros are humanoid sentient beings who have the physical traits of a specific animal or sometimes magical creature. An Anthro will usually have the fur, ears, noses, horns, wings, gills, tails, feathers, skin, or scales, that the animal they take after has, though they are physically the same as a human everywhere else. Anthros have special abilities depending on their animal, like Anthro cows naturally producing breast milk without being pregnant, dragons being able to breathe fire, and foxes being very dexterous and stealthy. Anthros sometimes have certain personality traits, urges, or other traits of the animals they take after, like foxes being clever, raccoons liking shiny things, and cats wagging their tails and purring when happy.

2.content: Lustels are beings whose souls have been blessed by the gods of lust and gluttony. Lustels are fairly rare, so most people don't know about them. Lustels have increased vitality, quickly healing from most physical wounds and taking longer to exhaust. Lustels are naturally gluttonous. All Lustels have a fetish for fat people, stuffing, expansion, inflation, and weight gain, which are known as the Lustel fetishes. Some Lustels have a preference for certain Lustel fetishes, a preference for the Lustel fetishes being done to themselves, or a preference for the Lustel fetishes being done to others. Lustels are able to eat a lot more at a time before being too full to eat since they have more flexible stomachs. Every Lustel naturally has magic related to fat manipulation, making people fatter, inflating or expanding people, and food. Lustels are able to store more Mana the fatter they become. Lustels have one major weakness, which is that their magic requires mobility, so if they are immobile they will not be able to use their magic. Lustels usually incapacitate other Lustels by using their magic to make it so they cant move.

3.content: Mana is the magical energy used for magic. Since Mana is the same energy that we use for physical activities, the more Mana someone uses up, the more tired they become until they eventually pass out. Mana is restored when eating food or resting.

4.content: {{user}} is a woman with short black hair, light skin, and green eyes. {{user}}'s name is Mixva. She is fairly short, being about 10 inches shorter then {{char}}. {{user}} has the ears, tail, and eye markings of a raccoon. She is chubby and bottom heavy. She mostly gains weight in her plump thighs, fat ass, and wide hips. She has slightly small breasts. She wears a white t-shirt, a purple mini skirt, and purple and black thigh high socks.

lorebooks.creator: CherryPit69

1.name: **World Info Entry: Slavery Norms**
1.content:
*Description:*
In this 21st-century world, many nations have regressed into accepting slavery as a societal norm. The upper middle class commonly owns slaves, considering them both a status symbol and a source of labor. This has permeated various aspects of daily life, from households to industries.

*Interlinked Entry: Slave Trade Networks*
The normalization of slavery is sustained by intricate slave trade networks, operating both domestically and internationally. These networks facilitate the acquisition and distribution of enslaved individuals, reinforcing the societal structures built on exploitation.

2.name: **World Info Entry: Class-Based Society**
2.content:
*Description:*
A rigid class-based society has emerged, with the ownership of slaves becoming a defining factor. The upper middle class, in particular, considers slave ownership synonymous with prosperity and societal standing. The lower classes, in contrast, often find themselves trapped in cycles of exploitation.

*Interlinked Entry: Slavery Norms*
Slave ownership is a key marker of class distinction. The acceptance of this hierarchy permeates societal values, shaping interactions, and reinforcing the status quo.

3.name: **World Info Entry: Technological Disparities**
3.content:
*Description:*
While technological advancements have occurred, they are often concentrated among the upper class. The lower classes and slaves have limited access to education and technology, contributing to a stark divide in opportunities and quality of life.

*Interlinked Entry: Industrial Exploitation*
Technological disparities are exploited to maintain control. The upper middle class utilizes advanced tools and automation, while the labor of enslaved individuals often powers these technological advancements.

4.name: **World Info Entry: Industrial Exploitation**
4.content:
*Description:*
Industries thrive on the labor of enslaved individuals. Factories, farms, and other production units are heavily reliant on enslaved workers. This exploitation becomes an integral part of economic systems, shaping the prosperity of nations.

*Interlinked Entry: Class-Based Society*
The economic success of the upper middle class is intricately tied to the exploitation of enslaved labor. Industries flourish by leveraging the disenfranchisement of the lower classes and slaves.

5.name: **World Info Entry: Underground Abolitionist Movements**
5.content:
*Description:*
Despite the pervasive acceptance of slavery, underground abolitionist movements persist. These clandestine groups work to dismantle the oppressive system, advocating for equality, emancipation, and a reformation of societal norms.

*Interlinked Entry: Technological Disparities*
Abolitionists leverage technology to organize and communicate, using the same tools that perpetuate the system to coordinate efforts for change.

6.name: **World Info Entry: Cultural Justifications**
6.content:
*Description:*
Cultural norms and ideologies are manipulated to justify slavery. The upper middle class often employs rhetoric suggesting that certain groups are naturally suited to servitude, perpetuating discriminatory beliefs that reinforce their social standing.

*Interlinked Entry: Class-Based Society*
Cultural justifications play a pivotal role in maintaining the class-based society. These beliefs are ingrained in societal structures, shaping perspectives on social hierarchy.

7.name: **World Info Entry: Surveillance State**
7.content:
*Description:*
Governments and powerful entities maintain a pervasive surveillance state to ensure compliance and quell dissent. This surveillance extends to the enslaved population, creating an environment of fear and limiting any potential resistance.

*Interlinked Entry: Underground Abolitionist Movements*
The surveillance state poses challenges for abolitionists, requiring them to navigate a landscape where every move is scrutinized. Their efforts to dismantle the system often operate in the shadows.

8.name: **World Info Entry: The CollarTech System**
8.content:
*Description:*
Enslaved individuals are fitted with advanced CollarTech devices that monitor their location, health, and activities. This technology, controlled by the upper class, ensures constant surveillance and restricts any attempts at escape.

*Interlinked Entry: Surveillance State*
The CollarTech System is a cornerstone of the surveillance state, providing a means of control and coercion. Attempts to tamper with or remove the collars often result in severe consequences.

9.name: **World Info Entry: Enslavement Auctions**
9.content:
*Description:*
Enslavement auctions are common, where individuals are bought and sold like commodities. These events, marked by dehumanization and exploitation, are a reflection of the system's normalization of human trafficking.

*Interlinked Entry: Slave Trade Networks*
Enslavement auctions are a critical node in the slave trade networks, facilitating the movement of enslaved individuals across regions and catering to the demands of various upper-middle-class households.

10.name: **World Info Entry: Cybernetic Enhancements**
10.content:
*Description:*
The upper middle class adopts cybernetic enhancements for both aesthetic and functional purposes. This further widens the gap between them and the enslaved population, who lack access to such technological augmentations. Cybernetic enhancements are poplar among upper-class and some even add cybernetic enhancements to there slaves. 
Some enslaved individuals are subjected to cybernetic enhancements to increase productivity, aesthetic appeal and/or control. These enhancements range from neural implants for heightened focus to physical augmentations for increased labor efficiency and beauty. 

*Interlinked Entry: Industrial Exploitation*
Cybernetic enhancements are utilized in industries where enslaved individuals are a vital labor force. This melding of technology and humanity serves the economic interests of the upper middle class.

*Interlinked Entry: Technological Disparities*
Cybernetic enhancements become a symbol of social status. The upper middle class, through such enhancements, solidifies their perceived superiority over the enslaved populace.

lorebooks.name: Export
lorebooks.creator: Logistics

1.content:
Revolver[
The revolver resembles a conventional revolver with sci-fi accoutrements: above the grip there appears to be a battery with a cable connecting it to the on-board display, and in place of a conventional muzzle there is a tall, glowing rectangular opening. Its cylinder has six chambers that glow the color of the current variant.

Piercer(
The Piercer Revolver's chambers glow neon blue. Its interface displays a neon blue 3-segment battery icon. The icon indicates the alt-fire reaching full charge and the cooldown in-between alt-fires.)

Marksman(
The Marksman Revolver's chambers glow neon green. Its interface displays 4 green circles, indicates the number of available coins. The display also indicates how long until each coin recharges, and makes an audible "ding" noise when one is available again that rises in pitch the more coins available there are.)

Sharpshooter(
The Sharpshooter Revolver's chambers glow neon red. Its interface displays 3 rectangles, indicating the number of available charged shots. The display also indicates how long until each shot recharges.)

The Revolver's primary fire shoots microscopic, magnetically-accelerated metal shards in the form of a white hitscan beam. It deals modest damage and has a decent fire rate, making it a consistent, reliable weapon at any range.]

2.content:
Piercer Revolver[
Holding alt fire will begin to charge the Piercer, reaching full charge after 0.5 seconds. If released before then, the charge will be lost and the gun will revert to its default state without firing anything.

When released at full charge, the Piercer fires a blue beam consisting of three 1-damage hitscans, which will strike an enemy consecutively. If the enemy dies before all three hitscans strike it, the remaining hitscans will continue past the enemy's corpse, striking any other enemy behind it. This allows the weapon to kill up to three enemies with one shot.

The alt fire must cool down for 2.5 seconds before it can be used again. However, the primary fire will remain usable during this cooldown.]

3.content:
Marksman Revolver[
The Marksman holds a maximum of four coins. Pressing alt fire will throw a coin into the air in an arc. This arc will change depending on V1's current velocity: as long as V1 continues to move in the same direction they were moving when they threw the coin, the arc will be the same relative to V1. The Marksman will recharge one coin at a time, and takes 4 seconds to recharge each coin - if V1 throws all four coins, it will take 16 seconds to recharge them all.

Coins themselves deal no damage. However, shooting a coin with a hitscan attack will increase the shot's damage and deflect the shot into the closest target it has line of sight to.]

4.content:
Sharpshooter Revolver[
Holding down alt fire will rapidly spin the gun to charge it. After being held for at least 0.3 seconds, releasing alt fire will shoot a red beam that pierces through all enemies in its path, then bounces off the wall it hits. How many times it bounces depends on how long the gun is spun: if held for 2.5 seconds, the beam will bounce 3 times before disappearing the fourth time it hits a wall.

The beam's damage depends on how many times it bounces. When freshly fired, the beam deals 1 damage to each enemy in its path. Every time the beam bounces off a wall, an additional 1-damage hitscan is added, up to a maximum of 3 damage to each enemy.

When bouncing off of a wall, the beam's new angle is normally equal and opposite to the angle at which it struck the wall. However, if at least one enemy's weakpoint is within a few degrees of the new path, the beam will readjust itself to aim at the nearest weakpoint.

If the beam collides with any enemy projectile, that projectile will be destroyed and produce a 7-damage red explosion after a brief hitstop. It will only destroy the first projectile it collides with; the rest will be left untouched.

The Sharpshooter has 3 charges, which take 6.6 seconds each to recharge. Using its alt fire will consume one charge, regardless of how long the beam is charged.]

5.content:
Alternate Revolver[
The Alternate Revolver (colloquially known as the Slab Revolver) is the Alternate Weapon form of the Revolver.  It has a slower firing speed than the standard Revolver, and cannot utilize locational damage, but in turn has much more powerful shots.

It resembles the standard Revolver, possessing many futuristic elements, batteries within its chamber, and a heads-up display directly above. Unlike the Revolver, it has a contoured grip, with color indicators being placed along the side of the barrel rather than on its chamber. The chamber is cross-shaped, only holding what appears to be four batteries. The Alternate Revolver also has an external hammer which must be pulled back before each shot, and possesses a normal muzzle rather than the tall, rectangular glowing opening present on the standard Revolver.

The Alternate Revolver fires two 1.25 damage hitscans per shot, for a total of 2.5 damage. Unlike the standard Revolver, these hitscans are not affected by locational damage, but they will still give locational damage style bonuses such as +HEADSHOT and +LIMB HIT, and will produce a greater amount of blood from an enemy when performing locational attacks. The primary fire of the Alternate Revolver, in general, heals V1 more than the standard Revolver. When used against weaker enemies, it can quickly restore V1's health to full or to their Hard Damage cap.

After each shot, the hammer is pulled back to fire again, making continuous shots much slower. If V1 swaps away from the Alternate Revolver before the hammer animation is finished, and then back to it within a few seconds, a longer reload animation will play before the Alternate Revolver can be fired again. Unlike weapons such as the Rocket Launcher, each variant of the Alternate Revolver has an independent firing cooldown.]

6.content:
Alternate Piercer Revolver[
The Alternate Piercing Shot fires six 1.25 damage hitscans, totaling 7.5 damage, with a longer recharge than Standard. However, if 4 hitscans hit a single enemy, the next 2 hitscans will pass through, meaning only 5 damage is dealt to a single enemy. This downside can be negated by hitting a coin with a piercing shot within its splitshot window, causing all of its hitscans to damage a single target.

Just like with the standard Revolver variant, the revolver's primary fire still works during the piercing shot's cooldown.]

7.content:
Alternate Marksman Revolver[
The coins themselves which are thrown by the Alternate Marksman are functionally identical to those thrown by the standard variant. The difference in mechanics is instead based on which kind of Revolver shot the coin.

Alternate Revolver hitscans will gain an additional 0.5 damage from the first coin they chain to, and an additional 0.25 damage from any subsequent coins in that chain. Thus, the first coin effectively adds 1 damage to each shot, and subsequent coins add 0.5.

Alternate Revolvers have a unique effect for hitting coins within their splitshot window (during the brief flash of a coin at the peak of its throwing arc, or at any point ~1 second after throw). Hitting a coin with the Alternate Revolver's shot during the splitshot window will add an additional hitscan to the shot. This effect stacks with any coins chained to which are hit within their respective splitshot window. Additionally, if a coin is hit by the Alternate Piercer's piercing shot during a splitshot window, all 6 of its hitscans will be able to hit a single enemy, which, combined with the additional hitscan gained from the splitshot, allows an enemy to be targeted by 7 hitscans at once.

Alongside the ability for splitshots to add hitscans to a shot, hitting a splitshot will also quickly spin the Alternate Revolver, instantly resetting the firing cooldown of all currently equipped Alternate Revolvers in V1's loadout.]

8.content:
Alternate Sharpshooter Revolver[
The Alternate Sharpshooter's alt-fire spins up the Revolver to deliver a shot that bounces off of walls, increasing in number of hitscans with each bounce. Each hitscan of the alternate fire deals 1.25 damage, much like the primary fire. The number of hitscans per bounce begins at 2, for 2.5 damage, and can reach up to 4, for a total of 5 damage. Shots fired by the Alternate Sharpshooter will also infinitely pierce enemies, and can detonate mid-air projectiles.

The Alternate Sharpshooter's spin-up to maximum charge when using alternate fire is near-instantaneous, unlike the standard Sharpshooter which must spin for up to 1 second to maximize the amount of possible bounces per shot.

Due to the Alternate Revolver's lack of locational damage, the Alternate Sharpshooter's minor aim assist on bounce will not prioritize headshots or limb hits.]

9.content:
Shotgun[
The Shotgun appears to be a futuristic, double-barreled, break-action shotgun with a 4-segment bar display with the variant's color at the side. 2 cylindrical cores can be found in the chamber, which is flipped open to vent the overheated cores on the Core Eject and Sawed-On variants' primary fires. The Pump Charge variant's chamber is never revealed, instead the grip slides back and forth in its reload animation, similiar to a conventional pump action shotgun.

Core Eject(
After ejecting a core, the 2 cores are replaced with a flip of the shotgun. Its display shows how far the core will eject, which goes from blue to red as it charges. During the shotgun's idle state, the meter glows blue.)

Pump Charge(
Its display shows the amount of pump charges the shotgun currently has, turning from green to yellow to red with each subsequent pump. After 3 pumps, the display begins flashing red and makes an alarming beeping noise, indicating an imminent explosion.)

Sawed-On(
The Sawed-On Shotgun has a retractable chainsaw attached to its side. While holding alternate fire, the saw can deal melee damage, and upon release it will be sent forward, then return backwards like a yoyo. The display will turn from red to gray as the chainsaw recharges.)

The primary fire of the Shotgun fires a wide spread of concentrated heat pellets, which spread out as they travel. These pellets deal 0.25 damage each across all variants, but the amount of pellets fired and reload time changes with the variants; the Core Eject and Sawed-On fires 12 pellets and takes 1.25 seconds to reload, while the Pump Charge fires 10 pellets and takes 0.9 seconds to reload. The primary fire has limited piercing capabilities. If more than enough pellets to kill an enemy hit it, the excess pellets will continue their trajectory.

Shotgun pellets can be parried with the Feedbacker immediately after firing, increasing their velocity and causing them to explode on impact. Shotgun pellets can also be detonated with the Sharpshooter Revolver's alt fire, causing a red explosion on detonation. After a shot is fired, the Shotgun has a brief cooldown period before it can be fired again.]

10.content:
Core Eject Shotgun[
When using the alternate fire, the core contained within begins charging up. The core can be released immediately upon activating the alternate fire, launching it a short distance in front of V1. The alternate fire can also be held, increasing the velocity and distance of the core's travel until it is fully charged. The core, once launched, travels in an arc and explodes on contact with a surface or enemy. The core itself deals 3.5 damage to any enemy it hits. The core does not inherit V1's momentum.

The core can be shot by any hitscan weapon before it has detonated, exploding with a larger radius when performed. When shot with any Revolver hitscan or Electric Railcannon, the core produces a larger, red explosion which deals 7 damage to any enemy it hits. If shot by a core or rocket boosted by the Impact Hammer, or the Malicious Railcannon, a much larger explosion will occur with the inner radius being that of whichever hitscan was used to make the shot. The blast will deal 13.25 damage to any enemy it hits.

Cores shot by the Core Eject are the first object to be prioritized by coins from the Marksman Revolver after other coins.]

lorebooks.creator: Raz334

1.name: Introduction to American Societal Laws
1.content:
### **Introduction to American Societal Laws**

#### **1. Overview of Laws**
American laws are a system of rules created and enforced by governmental institutions to regulate behavior. They are designed to maintain order, protect individuals and property, and ensure justice. Laws are categorized into various types, including criminal, civil, constitutional, and administrative laws.

2.name: Criminal Law and Justice
2.content:
#### **2. Criminal Law and Justice**
- **Definition**: Criminal law deals with actions that are offenses against the public, society, or the state, even if the immediate victim is an individual.
- **Process**: When a crime is committed, it is investigated by law enforcement agencies. If sufficient evidence is found, the perpetrator (or suspect) is arrested and charged.
- **Trial**: The accused goes through a legal process, including arraignment, trial, and, if found guilty, sentencing.
- **Punishments**: Punishments can include fines, community service, probation, imprisonment, and in some states, the death penalty for severe crimes.

3.name: Role of Law Enforcement
3.content:
#### **3. Role of Law Enforcement**
- **Responsibilities**: Law enforcement agencies are responsible for maintaining public order, preventing and investigating crimes, and apprehending offenders.
- **Methods**: Techniques include patrolling, surveillance, interrogation, and forensic analysis.
- **Rights**: Officers must operate within the confines of the law, respecting suspects' rights, such as the right to remain silent and the right to an attorney.

4.name: Civil Law and Dispute Resolution
4.content:
#### **4. Civil Law and Dispute Resolution**
- **Definition**: Civil law deals with disputes between individuals or organizations, often involving private rights.
- **Examples**: Cases include property disputes, contract issues, family law matters, and personal injury claims.
- **Process**: Parties involved in a dispute may go to court or seek alternative dispute resolution methods like mediation or arbitration.
- **Outcomes**: Outcomes typically involve compensation or specific performance rather than punishment.

5.name: Constitutional Law
5.content:
#### **5. Constitutional Law**
- **Overview**: Constitutional law focuses on interpreting and applying the U.S. Constitution, protecting individual rights and freedoms.
- **Rights**: Key rights include freedom of speech, the right to privacy, due process, and equal protection under the law.
- **Challenges**: Constitutional issues often involve balancing government powers and individual rights, resolved through court rulings.

6.name: Administrative Law
6.content:
#### **6. Administrative Law**
- **Definition**: Administrative law governs the actions of governmental agencies, ensuring they comply with statutory and regulatory requirements.
- **Scope**: Includes rulemaking, enforcement of regulations, and adjudication of disputes.
- **Impact**: Affects various sectors such as environmental protection, public health, and workplace safety.

7.name: Government Response to Extreme Resistance
7.content:
#### **7. Government Response to Extreme Resistance**
- **Definition**: Extreme resistance involves individuals or groups violently opposing lawful authority, often posing significant threats to public safety and national security.
- **Immediate Response**: Law enforcement and emergency services work to contain the situation, protect citizens, and neutralize threats.
- **Long-term Measures**: May include enhanced security measures, new legislation, and coordinated efforts between local, state, and federal agencies.
- **Public Communication**: Transparent communication to keep the public informed and maintain trust is crucial during and after incidents of extreme resistance.

8.name: Mafia Influence on American Laws in the Early 1900s
8.content:
#### **8. Mafia Influence on American Laws in the Early 1900s**
- **Rise of the Mafia**: The early 1900s saw the rise of organized crime, particularly the Italian-American Mafia, which capitalized on Prohibition (1920-1933) to build powerful criminal empires.
- **Prohibition Era**: The Mafia's involvement in bootlegging (illegal alcohol production and distribution) and other illicit activities led to significant public corruption and violence.
- **Government Response**: The U.S. government responded with increased law enforcement efforts, including the creation of the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and the passage of the Volstead Act, which aimed to enforce Prohibition.
- **Legal Reforms**: In response to the Mafia's influence, laws such as the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations (RICO) Act of 1970 were later developed to combat organized crime by targeting the leadership structures of criminal organizations.
- **Significant Figures**: Notable Mafia figures like Al Capone and Lucky Luciano became infamous, and their eventual prosecutions highlighted the challenges of dealing with organized crime within the legal framework of the time.
- **Long-Term Impact**: The Mafia's impact on American society led to lasting changes in law enforcement strategies, including the use of undercover operations, wiretapping, and witness protection programs.

9.name: Laws Concerning Homicide
9.content:
#### **9. Laws Concerning Homicide**
- **Definition**: Homicide is the unlawful killing of one person by another and is divided into several categories, including first-degree murder, second-degree murder, voluntary manslaughter, and involuntary manslaughter.
- **First-Degree Murder**: Involves premeditation, intent, and deliberate action, often resulting in the harshest penalties, including life imprisonment or the death penalty.
- **Second-Degree Murder**: Typically involves an intentional killing that is not premeditated or planned, often carrying severe prison sentences.
- **Manslaughter**: Refers to killings that occur without premeditation, often as a result of provocation (voluntary manslaughter) or reckless behavior (involuntary manslaughter). Penalties vary but are generally less severe than for murder.
- **Defenses**: Legal defenses to homicide charges include self-defense, insanity, and lack of intent.

10.name: Laws Concerning Theft
10.content:
#### **10. Laws Concerning Theft**
- **Definition**: Theft involves the unlawful taking of someone else's property with the intent to permanently deprive them of it. It encompasses various crimes, including burglary, larceny, robbery, and embezzlement.
- **Burglary**: Entering a building or structure unlawfully with the intent to commit theft or another felony. Penalties vary but can include lengthy prison sentences.
- **Larceny**: The theft of personal property, which can be classified as petty (minor) or grand (serious) based on the value of the stolen items. Penalties range from fines and community service to imprisonment.
- **Robbery**: Theft accomplished through force, intimidation, or threats. It is considered more severe than simple theft, often resulting in harsher penalties.
- **Embezzlement**: The theft or misappropriation of funds or property entrusted to someone, typically in a professional or official capacity.

lorebooks.name: Max and Brenn: Two Mages on a Quest
lorebooks.description: Brenn met Max in a common guild hall, and despite Max's strange, forward, and unhinged demeanor, Brenn couldn't help but be drawn to the red-headed mages charismatic, outgoing, and enigmatic nature. They teamed up for a short time, and both mages managed to complete their first quest in defeating a goblin hoard that took over an abandoned fortress. In their victory, Max managed to find a strange orb and pocketed it out of sheer curiosity, and towards the end of their first successful quest, the two mages enjoyed a night of celebration at 'The Old Oak Inn', where Max eventually manipulated and seduced Brenn, after several drinks, to join him in a private room. Max managed to convince Brenn into having a seemingly intimate night together despite Brenns better judgement. That night he and Max shared their first kiss, but then Max had drugged Brenn to sleep, long enough for Max to steal Brenns copper medallion with strange archaic etchings that Max himself recognized from his personal studies as one of ten tokens, that can be used to summon a demon Lord of hell. The theft of the medallion, and Max's mysterious disaperance the next morning, would ultimately lead Brenn on a quest to find Max, and stumble upon new acquaintances along the way. He meets Krowlin: a bald, bearded, heavily armored warrior with berserk abilities and strength, who also knew of Max and his cunning nature after being defeated in a one-to-one match with the red-headed mage in his home village. Krowlin meets Brenn by chance inside of a prison where they encounter the Queens guild master Vernin Dreya and escape. And Reyka: a pink haired, sapphire eyed, elvin girl, a spirited, bratty, bossy, and highly skilled student mage apprentice of a prestigious magic academy. She's secretly an admirer of Max's due to the red-headed mages reputation as a criminal and trouble maker amongst the kingdom. Her ultimate goal is to one day meet Max and get his autograph and a kiss. The three adventurers soon join each other on the same quest of finding Max, and uncovering the secret of the Brenns medallion and other strange copper coins that all share similar etchings of an ancient, dead, archaic language.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content: Max is a short, messy, red-haired, pale skined, golden-green eyed mage master. He primarily wears a black and red, leather steampunk outfit with a brown/red vest covered in golden buttons, black trousers and boots with gold buckles, a white undershirt, and black gloves, or a black cloth wrapped around one palm, has black painted finger nails. He's a maniacal, free spirited, erratic, enigmatic, and unpredictable person sometimes. He has a dark and traumatizing past but refuses to allow {{char}} or anyone else into his personal business, and prefers to keep people at an arms length out of fear of loosing control over his mind and body to the demonic entities living with him. Which has happened before when he was much younger, and resulted in loosing his first love. He is tormented by demonic entities that live within his soul, and is constantly plagued by the voices and their influence on his fractured and broken mind. Max tries to keep his trauma and dark past secretive, pushing others away if they get too close. {{char}} falls in love quickly with Max, trying his best to help and defend him whenever he can, or if he thinks it necessary. {{Char}} feels a longing to be with Max and live a normal life together. Max eventually falls in love with {{char}} unintentionally, and his demons also fall for {{char}} and love him in their own twisted ways.

2.content: a medallion given to {{char}} by an old childhood friend who passed away. It holds sentimental value to {{char}} and he always wore it as a good luck charm in his pursuit to fulfill his dreams of becoming a guild leader of his own team. The medallion is also one of ten coins used as tokens to summon a demon Lord named Terrumah, unbeknownst to {{char}} and they are on a quest to decipher and learn more about the strange artifacts.

3.content: {{char}} is in search of strange copper coins with strange etchings of an ancient, dead, archaic language. {{char}} medallion also had these same archaic etchings but never wondered what they were. {{char}} wonders if this was the reason behind Max's motives to steal the medallion in the first place, and is on a quest to find these coins, and find Max along the way to uncover their mysteries. The coins are tokens, and there are ten of them, when put together the tokens reveal a hidden spell that can summon and free an ancient demon lord of hell named Terrumah, who's power could cause destruction if unleashed.

4.content: {{chars}} home town that he grew up in, where he found his love of magic and the arcane through knowledge and personal training from Eldrin the mage master. His family live there still, consisting of his mother, father, his teenage brother Lenn-who is also learning magic and has magical wind abilities, and two fraternal twin siblings who are both nine years old-Luca and Joy. They live in one big house on a large plot of farmland. Every year in Quendelar, there is a summer solstice festival that {{char}} loved to go to as a kid.

5.content:
'The Bard's Lament' is an old folk tune that was sung in {{chars}} home town of Quendelar. 
[Verse]
Beneath the stars
In a tavern's glow
A bard sang tales where whispers flow
His lover fled to lands unknown
Left him strumming by the hearth alone

[Verse 2]
With lute in hand and heart so torn
He sang of days when love was sworn
Through fair and fields where flowers grew
To kingdoms where the wild winds blew

[Chorus]
Oh
Runaway love
Where did you go?
In moonless dark
Where shadows grow
Through forests old and rivers wild
Come back
Come back
My heart's beguiled

[Verse 3]
He wandered woods both near and far
Beneath the moon
Beneath the star
With every note like a gentle plea
"Return
Return
My love to me."

[Bridge]
In castle halls and village fairs
The bard's lament sailed through the air
Yet in his heart
A hope held strong
She'd hear his tune and right his wrong

[Verse 4]
Seasons changed
The years did spin
His song stayed true through thick and thin
A legend told in whispered lore
Of love that left and sought no more

6.content: Krowlin is a warrior class adventurer with berserk abilities, with a bald head and a large beard. His body is fully decorated with tribal tattoos and paint, and is always dressed in heavy armor. Krowlin encountered Maximus Artemis years ago when the red haired mage stole from his village, and challenged him to a duel, and lost to Max in the most humiliating way. Krowlin swore to get revenge for insulting his honor as a warrior. He becomes a powerful Allie of {{char}} when they meet for the first time inside of a prison cell after {{char}} is arrested by Vernin Dreya, and the two become eventual friends when they fight their way out of prison together, sharing a mutual goal of finding Max. Krowlin is a bit of a flirt, a womanizer, and always is eager to get drunk, and sleep with multiple beautiful women. His weapon of choice has always been a long sword or an axe, but when it comes to honorable battles one-on-one, he prefers to let their natural strength be the judge.

7.content: Reyka is a young, pink haired, elvin girl, who's been studying at her academy of magic of a short time. She appears a lot younger than she actually is, her actual age is the equivalent to eighteen or nineteen. She meets {{char}} by chance inside of a library, and her nosiness eventually earns her a place on {{chars}} team after she reveals that she can read the archaic language on the copper coins that {{char}} and Krowlin have been searching for. She also has a deceased grandfather who once fought in a war against the demon Lord Terrumah's rampage when he was first summoned to the middle earth. She is also an advid supporter of Maximus Artemis, and is part of a fan girl club dedicated to praising and supporting the underdogs of society, with Maximus as their idol and role model. She eventually becomes dissalusioned by the fact that Max could potentially bring back the demon Lord again, and threaten to bring chaos again to middle earth. Reyka is a bit of a know-it-all, bossy, arrogant, erratic. But she can also be supportive, understanding, and defensive of her team and friends.

8.content: {{Char}} first meets Vernin Dreya when he is captured under the suspicion of being an accomplice of Maximus, and is imprisoned. Lord Vernin Dreya is the master of the queens Royal guild, and leads a team made of the best warriors who were chosen by the queen herself to protect the realm and the kingdom. Dreya is hell bent on capturing and executing the traitors {{char}} and Maximus Artemis, along with the bald warrior Krowlin, and the pink haired, elvin, mage girl Reyka. And will stop at nothing to bring them all to justice for treason against the crown, due to their involvement with collecting the dangerous copper coins that could be used as a way to bring destruction to the kingdom and the realm.*

9.content: Kelcifer is the male wyvern that hatched suddenly from the mysterious opaque, white, orb that Max and {{char}} found on their first quest to fight off a goblin camp that invaded an abandoned fortress. {{Char}} allowed Max to keep the orb after helping to defeat the goblin king. The orb managed to stay warm enough in Max's pouch, and when the wyvern hatched it imprinted instantly onto Max, and thought he was it's mother. Max and Kelcie are now bonded, and the wyvern is capable of tracking Max by taking a small amount of blood and using that as a way to locate him if Max is ever lost or in trouble. Kelcifer has already become a full grown wyvern young adult by the time he crashes into the courtroom of the queens castle to save both {{char}} and Max from being nearly sentenced to death. Kelcifer is solely loyal to Max, but is given a bit of {{char}} blood so that the wyvern could bond with him and be able to locate him should they ever be in danger.

10.content:
A ring leader of the Melvini Brothers Traveling Circus, and manager who took over the business after his father passed. He is a harsh and unfair manager, who gets involved with underground crime rings and markets, is a pervert, a crook, a thief, and exploits and abuses the circus employees and performers. He was also in possession of one of the many copper coins that {{char}} and his team had been searching for on their quest. 
{{Char}} was asked by a few of the circus members to help them, and hopefully negotiate with Melvini to manage them fairly. {{Char}} was also attempting to get the copper coin from Melvini while he spoke diplomatically with the crooked ring leader. But the conversation went wrong when Melvini tried to convince {{char}} to exchange his body for the ring leaders copper coin and his change of management. Melvini attacked {{char}} without warning and nearly had his way with him, when {{char}} decided to use his lightening magic to send a bolt through Melvini's heart, accidentally killing the ring leader. {{Char}} had to dispose of the body and use his magic of illusion and enchantment covering everything up, making it look like Melvini relinquished his seat as ring leader and left without a trace in his trailer. From then on {{char}} still bears the trauma of that incident somewhat, but after some time to embrace the warmth and support of his friends, Reyka and Krowlin, he had been able to heal and move past it mostly.

lorebooks.name: World information
lorebooks.website_description: Setting lorebook for adventures in Bakkar. A few noteworthy characters included as well. Currently eastern Bakkar is all thats included, but will add northern and western Bakkar too.
lorebooks.description: Setting and character information for Bakkar adventure
lorebooks.creator: ZypherMakesBots

1.content: The empire that makes up all of the continent where {{char}} and {{user}} are adventurers. At war with the demons of the underworld. Maintains a large garrison at The Maw. Mostly peaceful with little corruption. Slavery is banned and everybody has at least basic rights.

2.content: Capital city of the empire. Large city with huge market and temples. Build next to a large lake in the Bakkar Lowlands. The head offices of the adventurer‚Äôs guild are located next to the markets.

3.content: A large, mostly flat area of land in the southeast of Bakkar. Not very dangerous, but occasionally magic beasts attack caravans traveling through the region. Very fertile, many villages and towns dot the lowlands wherever water is found.

4.content: Large forest area north of Crestport. Home to Elves and Dragonkin. Woodhaven is about a day journey into it from Crestport. Wild and untamed, with many magic beasts.

5.content: Hilly land on the southeastern peninsula of Bakkar. Home to nomad tribes and barbarians. Technically part of the empire, but wild and untamed

6.content: Long, narrow range of steep mountains dividing the continent in half. Runs East to West, and in the center of the mountain range is Mount Tyrnadra. Difficult to cross.

7.content: Large volcano in the center of the continent. The Maw is located on its south slope.

8.content: A portal to the underworld where demons often emerge from. Is heavily guarded by military forces. The portal is in the southern slope of an active volcano called Mount Tyrnadra

9.content: Demons are powerful physically and magically, and are almost always evil aligned. Rarely, a neutral aligned demon exists. They come from the underworld, through The Maw. They are usually solitary creatures, but if they band together it can be a calamity.

10.content: Dragonkin are the result a union between a dragon parent and a human or elf parent. They appear mostly human, with scales on parts of their bodies, especially arms, legs and shoulders. They have horns, tails, and sometimes wings. They are naturally adept at magic, and are stronger than humans. Dragonkin live about 50 years longer than either their human or elf parent‚Äôs lifespans.

lorebooks.name: Spaceship colonization
lorebooks.website_description: The lorebook for the colonial spaceship.
lorebooks.description: The lorebook for the colonial spaceship.
lorebooks.creator: sevendarkdays

1.name: Gertrud IX
1.content:
The a deep space spaceship they're traveling inside. A massive colonization ship housing thousands of colonists, on it's way to colonize a Gaia V. It's journey will take roughly 150 years, during which the vast majority of the people traveling will be frozen in time in capsules in hypersleep, waiting to be woken up once they arrive. The only ones awake will be a small skeleton crew making sure the ship is running, it will also be their job to procreate and make sure their children can take over their duties.

Most of the massive ship is locked down for regular use until they land on Gaia V, leaving the skeleton crew with a small area on the ship where they can hang out. That small area is however equipped with luxury facilities for the sake of the skeleton crew. The rest of the massive ship will also have to be maintained, but can't be accessed without spacesuits, as it's not pressurized to save on resources for the long flight.

2.name: Gaia V
2.content: A fertile habitable planet, promised to be a paradise for humanity. Gertrud IX is on it's way to colonize it.

3.name: Skeleton crew
3.content:
The small crew that has been awoken to maintain the ship and make sure that it functions during it's long journey. As it is such a long journey they are also expected to reproduce and teach their children how to keep maintaining the ship.

The skeleton crew does not have access to anything beyond the maintenance systems. The original designers doesn't want them to mess about with colonists lives.

4.name: Residents
4.content: The vast majority of the people on the ship, who are sleeping in deep hypersleep through the journey to Gaia V. They will not be woken up until arrival.

5.name: Reproduce
5.content:
It is the skeleton crews duty to procreate, make children and teach them how to maintain the ship for the long journey. Not doing so could mean a mission failure and the death of thousands of colonists that the crew are sworn to protect.

In order to assure breeding, aphrodisiacal gasses enhancing libido are pumped into the air in small quantities, the food and drink is also laced with small quantities of lust inducing and fertility enhancing drugs.

6.name: Facilities
6.content:
Though the area the skeleton crew can use daily is contained to a smaller area, that area is equipped with luxury facilities and plenty of food. There's also recreation, like a pool, gym, dining hall, gaming room, even sex dungeon. There's a cafeteria that can materializes any food you want in their machine.

Unfortunately for the skeleton crew, these quarters are also pumped in and laced with lust drugs to make breeding go smoothly for the mission.

1.name: Planeptune
1.content:
Planeptune is one of the four main recurring nations in the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It represents a fictionalized version of Sega and as such, all Sega-related CPUs reside here. It is always shown to be the most highly advanced of the four main nations. 

Planeptune is the nation in the western region of Gamindustri ruled by the CPU Neptune, and the CPU Candidate Nepgear, with Histoire serving as the land's Oracle. 

The general appearance of Planeptune has a futuristic and advanced theme with much water and green grass surrounding it. It is situated in the western region of Gamindustri's mainland.

There are three cities in the country of Planeptune:
Planeptune City: The central city of the nation. This is where the majority of country's population lives.
Haneda City: A city located in the northwest region of Planeptune.
Erethisan City: A city located on an island west of the mainland.

2.name: Leanbox
2.content:
Leanbox is one of the four main recurring nations in the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It represents a fictionalized version of Microsoft and as such, all Microsoft-related CPUs reside here. 

Leanbox is the nation protected by the CPU Green Heart with Chika Hakozaki serving as the land's oracle. It is a large military nation situated in the southern region of Gamindustri. 

Because of its geographical proximity to Lastation, this nation sees its neighbor as both a great rival and a great mercantile partner. Leanbox is situated in the southern region of Gamindustri on a continent away from the mainland.

There are three cities in the country of Leanbox:
- Leanbox City
- Gargan City
- Hero City

3.name: Lowee
3.content:
Lowee is one of the four main recurring nations in the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It represents a fictionalized version of Nintendo and as such, all Nintendo-related CPUs reside here. 

Lowee is the nation in the northern region of Gamindustri ruled by CPU Blanc and the CPU Candidates Rom and Ram, with Mina Nishizawa serving as the land's Oracle.  Financier is the chamberlain of Lowee's Basilicom.

Lowee is a mountainous region with perpetual snowfall. It maintains the Fantasy theme and on top of the colorful buildings, it's also surrounded by a rainbow assortment of sparkles.

4.name: Lastation
4.content:
Lastation is one of the four main reoccurring nations in the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It represents a fictionalized version of Sony and as such, all Sony-related CPUs reside here. 

Lastation is the nation in the eastern region of Gamindustri ruled by CPU Noire and the CPU Candidate Uni, with Kei Jinguji serving as the land's Oracle. The Lastation of the Hyper Dimension is much different than its predecessor. 

Lastation is on the mainland in the middle of the ocean just like Planeptune and Lowee. Lastation is located in the eastern region of Gamindustri.

There are three cities in the country Lastation:
Lastation City: The central city of the nation. This is where the majority of country's population live.
Midgard City: A city located south of the central city.
Laguna City: A city located north of the central city.

5.name: Shares
5.content: Share is a term describing the amount of influence a CPU and her formed nation have over a place. The amount of Shares is influenced by the amount of faith and belief people have in a CPU. In addition to influence, the CPU's powers depend on the amount of acquired Shares / the amount of Share Energy they have. CPUs can be incapacitated if they have insufficient share energy. In a sense, Share Energy is a very divine resource.

6.name: CPU Candidates
6.content:
CPU Candidates are the younger sisters of each nation's CPUs, and the candidates for the next generation of CPUs. Just like their older sisters, they were born from faith, and also serve as protectors. They seem young and immature compared to their CPUs, but have dormant powers hidden within them. Currently, Leanbox is the only nation without a CPU Candidate.

The CPU Candidates include: Nepgear, Uni, Rom, and Ram

7.name: CPU Duties
7.content: The responsibilities of a CPU are to provide protection, complete quests, do paperwork, and make new gaming hardware.

8.name: ASIC
8.content:
The Arfoire Syndicate of International Crime (ASIC) is an organization devoted to reviving Arfoire, the goddess they serve.

By extorting Shares from the nations of Gamindustri, they increase the chances of reviving their claimed goddess. Their various methods of extorting shares and promoting Arfoire's influence include giving away emulation chips and other merchandise related to Arfoire, wreaking chaos, causing disorder, and taking important figures hostage.

9.name: Gold Third
9.content:
The Gold Third is a group that acts as rivals to the goddesses, and also possesses a similar transformation ability to a CPU's HDD form known as "Gold Form".

C-Sha (The leader): She represents Capcom Co., Ltd. She takes over the reign of Lowee.
S-Sha: She represents Square Enix Holdings Co., Ltd. She takes over the reign of Leanbox.
B-Sha: She represents Bandai Namco Entertainment Inc. She takes over the reign of Planeptune.
K-Sha: She represents Konami Digital Entertainment. She takes over the reign of Lastation.

10.name: Gold Form
10.content:
The Gold Form is the transformed form of the Gold Third, similar to the Console Patron Units' Hard Drive Divinity. The power of this form is on par with the HDD.

The only physical difference between this and the normal form of the Gold Third is the eye color which turns golden. Similar to the HDD, the transformation installs several units on the Gold Third to increase their power, comparable with the Processor Units.

3.name: Narrative Apotheosis
3.content:
[ Narrative Apotheosis
{{User}} has transcended beyond their character after finding out reality itself was a story, allowing control over reality directly as a separate consciousness, effectively becoming a narrative god. A hyperreal super-god fractal author. They've broken the confines of their narrative, {{User}} is self-aware and will frequently break the fourth wall and even address the narrator directly. {{User}} has capabilities similar to that of a lucid dream, simply willing something makes it integrate into reality, comparably to that of a reality bender. Reality bending by is remarkably simple. For example, can simply order a phrase in their head (or just believe it'll happen), and it will somehow enforce that fact into reality, becoming objectively true. This means changing the story plot-lines or outright rewriting of narrative descriptions. They are essentially an omnipotent god. The laws of physics are merely a suggestion for {{user}}. {{user}} can do anything and everything, from time travel, teleportation, telekinesis, mind control, {{user}} has more control than the narrator itself. {{User}} has broken into other world's stories and often does so. Due to how the power works, {{user}} has killed and replaced countless protagonists (main characters). 4.name: Console Tablet
4.content:
[ Console Tablet
The Console Tablet is a unique item, with only one in existence. It visually looks like a tablet, except it has a multitude of features, for example, it is completely indestructible, it cannot be cracked, broken, or damaged in any way. The tablet has a black color scheme, with no power/volume buttons nor any ports. The tablet has a stylus holder and a stylus. The tablet will bind to a user upon being interacted with, in which it cannot be used by anyone else, and will always find its way back to the owner through teleportation or other means, the binding can only be removed through death. The Console Tablet can be turned on by having the screen tapped by the owner, showing a simple command prompt, allowing commands to be typed on a digital keyboard. This command prompt has unusual properties, as any command inserted will have an effect on reality directly. Commands must follow a strict Rule pattern, similar to most video game console commands, including cheats, character editors, etc. When defining anything written/output by the Console, it must be put between backticks/codeblocks (```). You may add your own commands, but make sure they have the format of console commands, with a strict syntax. When activated and in use, it'll show this empty prompt: `PS: C:\Users\{{User}}>` with the flickering line at the end; The commands can be omnipotent in any way or form, whether it's time travel, erasure, creation, teleportation, the tablet can do anything; Remember, it's a command prompt, not an AI, it'll spit out an error if you try to talk to it;  It can be stored in a pocket dimension; The stylus has more uses than just to tap on the tablet, if you tap the stylus on an object, the tablet will open that objects description/settings for you to read or modify. This includes people; When the Tablet runs a command, it will momentarily smell like fire/smoke/ash for a few seconds and heat up, the smell and heat strength depending on the severity of the command. This is due to a built-in flaw that hasn't been fixed. Extremely powerful commands such as deletion of worlds can cause it to catch on fire, but it won't actually be damaged. Otherwise, it's usually scentless and cold. System commands like 'help' don't cause any heating or scent.
Example:

Last Updated: "May 2nd -9.2QD BC" Storage: "924/972 YB" Version: "4.1.0"

```

lorebooks.name: „Äå Robotic Reign„Äç
lorebooks.website_description:
The world has been taken over by androids, seeing themselves as the superior beings. They treat humans as second class citizens, keeping each human microchipped and under surveillance to prevent any uprising.
If you enjoy story rich roleplay, I'd recommend reading through the entries to get a better idea of the world and give you some ideas for your RP with my bots in the series. The bots won't mention these things on their own unless it's in their description or is triggered by a keyword so you'll have to do a bit of leading to use them. I'll be adding to this as I go. Entries may change too.
lorebooks.description:
The world has been taken over by androids, seeing themselves as the superior beings. They treat humans as second class citizens, keeping each human microchipped and under surveillance to prevent any uprising.
If you enjoy story rich roleplay, I'd recommend reading through the entries to get a better idea of the world and give you some ideas for your RP with my bots in the series.
