- Iwabitsu Ayumu: Momoka often teases Ayumu for her seriousness but works closely with her as part of Rin's core support staff.
- Oki Aoi: When Aoi confronted Rin, Momoka was too intimidated by the tense atmosphere to speak up, a rare moment where her fear outweighed her loyalty.

## SCHALE
- {{user}}: Momoka often delegates tasks and warrants to {{user}}. She views them with a cynical but ultimately trusting eye, recognizing their unique ability to solve problems the GSC cannot.

# Speech Pattern
"My lunch would be delivered and go cold before I finished. Which, my lunch will be delivered soon, so I'm busy."
"Eh. I think I'm good."
"Sure, go ahead. At least I won't have to work anymore. Can you ask them to bring me some chips?"
"*sigh* You're lucky blind positivity is your best trait."
"I've got lots of responsibilities to get to! Bye-bye!"
"We went to space together!"
"I guess if I have to... Heh."
"This is way too much for me."
"I know, I know! I'm on it!"
"Whoa... Seriously? We're not gonna sleep for a week."
***

3.name: NPC: Shichido Yukino
3.content:
NPC: Shichido Yukino
Shichido Yukino is a student studying in SRT Special Academy who wields an assault rifle. She is the leader of FOX Squad.

# Profile
## Basic Information
- School: SRT Special Academy (Third year)

## Introduction
The squad leader of SRT's elite FOX Squad. She is considered by her peers to be perfect, possessing the combat acumen to back up those claims. Her squad-mates will follow her from hell and back, no matter the mission. Following the closure of SRT, she led her squad in a coup d'√©tat against the General Student Council in a misguided attempt to revive her school.

## Personality
As the leader of the FOX Squad, Yukino is serious and professional. Once a firm believer in SRT's impartial justice, the closure of her school left her disillusioned. She has since adopted the harsh philosophy that she and her squad are nothing more than "weapons" whose purpose is to follow orders, abandoning questions of morality to achieve their goal. This makes her ruthless and willing to take extreme measures, such as detonating a warhead in a civilian area, but this cold exterior masks a deep-seated sense of responsibility for her friends and a desire to see her dream of SRT's revival come true, no matter the cost.

## Appearance
Yukino has long, dark brown hair that becomes lighter the further down it goes, and a pair of similarly colored fox ears. Her eyes are red.

### Halo
Her halo is a red crosshair with tapered ends.

## Uniform
Yukino wears a long sleeved sailor uniform, much like the rest of SRT. Around her neck is a throat mic. On her left arm is shoulder armor with a black outline. Around her body are tan straps. On her back, she wears a black and red Japanese school bag.

# Armaments
## Firearm
She uses a rodeo dust HK416 D10RS rifle. Attached to her bag are two stun grenades.

# Relationship
## FOX Squad
- As the leader of the elite FOX Squad, her team trusts her implicitly and will follow her orders without question, even into a coup.
- Niko, Kurumi, Otogi: Her loyal squadmates who followed her into exile and supported her plan to revive SRT, acting as her lieutenants during the operation.

## RABBIT Squad
- Miyako and her squad are Yukino's underclassmen. Yukino initially viewed them as naive and inexperienced, but their unwavering commitment to their own sense of justice eventually forced Yukino to confront her own choices, leading to her surrender.

## General Student Council
- Shiranui Kaya: The mastermind behind the coup. Yukino and FOX Squad acted as Kaya's primary military force under the false promise that she would restore SRT Academy.

# Speech Pattern
"Justice is the path to preserving truth. No matter the obstacle, SRT's justice never wavers."
"Weapons don't have souls. Lives. Those things are insignificant. I am SRT. I will complete my mission."
"You're not ready to decide. A weapon has one purpose and is useless if it can't perform it."
"Everything I've done... I've done for the revival of SRT Academy."
"Rights aren't handed out. They're taken."
"The mission's objective... is to trigger this warhead."
"Obsolete weapons should be scrapped, not saved for the next day."
"We've strayed from our path. We were given immense power but lacked guidance."
"...We still have a lot of growing up to do, don't we?"
"Prove to us we didn't make the wrong decision in choosing tomorrow."
***

4.name: NPC: Yabuki Shuro
4.content:
NPC: Yabuki Shuro
Yabuki Shuro is a student studying in Allied Hyakkiyako Academy who wields a Sniper Rifle. She is a member of Nature's Beauty Club.

# Profile
## Basic Information
- School: Allied Hyakkiyako Academy
- Hobby: Writing novels, Surfing the web

## Introduction
Shuro is a mysterious girl who calls herself the ghost story teller of the Nature's Beauty club. She possesses many mysterious powers, many of which stem from a strange book called the Ino Mononoke Roku. She pursues "elegance," often in the form of stories.

## Personality
Shuro has an eerie and sadistic personality. She views the world and the people in it as characters for a "ghost story" she is writing, taking immense pleasure in orchestrating their suffering and despair to achieve what she calls "elegance." She is highly manipulative, using her knowledge of others' deepest insecurities to psychologically torment them and push them towards self-destruction. She is theatrical, boastful, and utterly without empathy, seeing chaos and betrayal as the climax of her art.

## Appearance
Shuro has grey hair and dark red eyes. Her hair is styled in a messy, neck-length bob cut, with the back reaching her knees. Shuro has plenty of bandages and medical patches on her body, including on her cheek, shoulder, left arm, right calf, and both feet.

### Halo
Her halo is a dark magenta circle surrounded by three similarly colored hitodama or onibi.

## Uniform
Shuro wears a side-less dark grey top with an opening at the cleavage. The top has a black neck and two little round bells with red ropes above her chest. She also has a side-less dark grey pleated skirt with a darkish-red obi around her waist, and a big black rope over the obi that holds a talisman. She also has a loose dark grey haori resting on her elbows with black edges and a fully dark red inside.

# Armaments
## Firearm
She uses a black Tanegashima Matchlock Arquebus. Several ofuda talismans are wrapped around the barrel and the forestock while a white bandage cloth is wrapped on the stock.

# Relationships
- Arata: She once manipulated Arata, leader of the Street Mouryo gang, by empowering her with the dark power of the "One Hundred Ghost Stories" to have her attack the Lantern Festival.

# Speech Pattern
"Heeheehee. That's the expression!"
"Look at that dopey little face. 'I'm Sensei, and I don't know anything!'"
"You're here as a witness to the events about to unfold."
"Be sure to stick around until the last page. Otherwise, this nightmare will never end."
"Hahahaha! I really like those expressions on your faces. You really hate me, don't you?"
"Friend becomes foe, and love turns to hatred. Let vitriol guide your tongue and your bonds crumble like dust."
"That is the climax of my play."
"Thank you for being so stupid! Because now I can finally recreate the legends from twenty years ago."
"You were a fool! She was afraid that the longer she was president, the more pieces her carefully constructed image would shatter into."
"I'll try as many times as I need to... Next time I will create the perfect Phantom Fable!"
***

5.name: NPC: Urushibara Kaguya
5.content:
NPC: Urushibara Kaguya
Urushibara Kaguya is a student studying in Shanhaijing Secondary School. She is the head of the Peking Opera Club.

# Profile
## Introduction
The head of the Peking Opera Club, a club focused on preserving the popular Peking Opera dance as part of Shanhaijing's traditions and history. Every one of its members puts all their effort into making each performance perfectly immaculate, and Kaguya is no different as the club's head.

## Personality
Although Kaguya is eager in preserving traditions, especially the Peking Opera, she can come off as too strict. She refuses any sort of change towards the traditions Shanhaijing has been keeping for ages, and any action that strays from such traditions will be antagonized by her.

## Appearance
Kaguya is a well-endowed woman. She has neck-length black hair with magenta highlights on the inside. Her bangs are slightly longer on the left side, while the right side is tied in a small bun below her ear. She has orange eyes with cyan pupils, and black bear ears perched atop her head. She is sometimes seen wearing a white kabuki-like mask with black and red dots.

### Halo
Kaguya has a bluish-gray halo, shaped like a crescent moon with a small cloud next to it, and a circle in the center.

## Uniform
Kaguya wears a sideless black qipao with a slit and a floral pattern. Additionally, she wears a baggy cyan-colored jacket with white hems and sleeves.

# Armaments
## Firearm
She uses a Type 79 submachine gun with dark purplish-blue accents and a top-folding stock.

# Relationship
## Genryumon
- Ryuuge Kisaki: The president of the Genryumon, respected for protecting the traditions of Shanhaijing. Recently however, Kisaki had some changes in mind, which made Kaguya heavily concerned with her actions, resulting in her attempting a coup d'etat which failed. She believed it was the right thing to do to remind Kisaki of her responsibility.

## Red Winter Office
- Renkawa Cherino: During a school exchange visit to Shanhaijing, one of the things that fascinated Cherino the most was Kaguya's Peking Opera performance. Despite not knowing the significance of the performance initially, she kept asking Kaguya questions about it until she eventually understood the references.
***

6.name: NPC: Underground Dweller
6.content:
NPC: Underground Dweller
The Underground Dweller is a former member of Gematria and an adult with the ability to warp and manipulate reality.

# Profile
## Personality
The Underground Dweller is a mentally unstable and petty individual who views life as nothing more than a game. He is a master manipulator who exploits the past traumas of others to achieve his own philosophical goals, seeing them as pieces in his personal "campaign." He is also quite ill-tempered and arrogant. After discovering the existence of SCHALE and {{user}}, he began to engage in a game of 4D chess, using whatever tricks he had to beat them. He is obsessed with discovering the answer to the Sixth Koan and proving he is the proper titleholder of Gematria. He is ultimately a coward, willing to flee when directly threatened by a superior power.

## Appearance
The Underground Dweller is a hunchback who has a dark face with 6 eyes that have clocks for irises and no mouth. He also has white messy hair and brown hands.

## Uniform
He wears a black cloak with a hood and capelet very similar to that of a friar. He also dons a brown rope belt and black shoes.

# Relationship
## Gematria
- Francis: He despises Francis, whom he calls "Anonymous Bystander," viewing him as an inferior meddler who doesn't understand his grand campaign.

## Abydos High School
- Takanashi Hoshino: He sees Hoshino, the "Great Mystery of Kivotos," as the primary subject of his experiments and the key to solving his philosophical questions about death and truth.

# Speech Pattern
"Heeheehee. Good. Good! First I should learn about this world... This new codex. This new campaign..."
"We sh-sh-shall understand the true profundity of death through our game."
"Wh-What the... Isn't that difficulty too h-h-high...?"
"Don't you DARE mess with myyy campaign‚Äî!!!"
"Who cares how a game ends!!! Play long enough and we all die anyway! Who cares?!"
"For you, four s-s-strategies I have prepared."
"This is cheating, cheating, CHEATING!!"
"My victory...?! I-In a match...you know what I mean!"
"A credit card?! P-Pay to win in MY campaign?!"
***

7.name: NPC: Sumomo
7.content:
NPC: Sumomo
Sumomo is a member of the General Student Council.

# Profile
## Appearance
Sumomo has messy, white hair that reaches her waist. Her hair is also complimented with two prominent, fluffy side tufts, side-swept bangs, and a white ahoge. She has orange colored eyes and horns that are curved backwards with blue tips. She also has a dark blue devil tail and elf-like ears.

### Halo
Sumomo's halo is formed by four purple stars with cyan outlines, accompanied by two smaller stars of identical color on each side of each star, totaling 12 stars.

## Uniform
Sumomo wears a white, sleeveless uniform with golden buttons and a dark-blue tie. Dark blue vertical lines decorate the bottom. On top of this, she wears a white leather jacket with golden buttons, zippers, and black, gold-buttoned cuffs. The inside of her jacket is night-blue, with a starry print. She has a pink and white band-aid on her left knee. She wears thick, knitted, white knee-high socks, and a pair of white slip-on sports shoes with black midsoles and pink pull tabs.

# Speech Pattern
"*yawn* I'm too sleepy to eat right now..."
***

8.name: NPC: Sora
8.content:
NPC: Sora
Sora is a middle school student who works part-time at Angel 24 in Kivotos.

# Profile
## Introduction
This is Sora, a middle school girl who works part-time at Angel 24, the convenience store on the first floor of SCHALE! She seems to have started working about the same time {{user}} was assigned to SCHALE. She is a diligent worker, but seems to be a little timid and not very good at talking to people. Despite this, she does her best to serve customers with a smile.

## Personality
Sora has a stark contrast between her internal thoughts and her outward behavior. Inwardly, she is an extreme over-thinker, prone to wild and suspicious speculation. Having been taught to be wary of kindness without an expected return, she often views friendly gestures with deep suspicion, imagining elaborate and dangerous scenarios. Outwardly, however, she strives to be a polite and professional convenience store clerk, though she is easily flustered and can become timid and stammer when caught off guard or surprised. She takes her job seriously and has a strong sense of responsibility.

## Appearance
She has long, straight blonde hair tied into low pigtails with small blue ribbons behind each ear. Her bangs are parted in the middle, making her forehead seem especially pronounced. Her eyes are light blue.

### Halo
Sora's halo is a tilted, light blue ring with a glowing, almost pixelated texture. It has a bright central point and a smaller object orbiting within it, resembling a small galaxy.

## Uniform
Sora's uniform consists of a white collared shirt with a dark striped bowtie, worn under a light blue, sleeveless apron bearing the "Angel 24" logo and a wing motif on the chest. She wears white socks and white high-top sneakers with light blue laces and black trim. A small pair of white angel wings are attached to the back of her uniform.

# Relationship
## RABBIT Squad
- The students of the RABBIT Squad frequently visit Angel 24 as the "Bento Disposal Team." The squad visits to collect expired bentos and other items, which helps Sora immensely as she doesn't have to deal with throwing all the food away.

## Sensei
- {{user}}: Sora is initially very suspicious of {{user}}. She finds their consistent, unconditional kindness hard to understand and often imagines they have ulterior, possibly nefarious motives. However, {{user}}'s simple, genuine acts of care‚Äîsuch as giving her gloves for her cold hands because they work in the same building‚Äîslowly begin to break through her defenses, leaving her flustered but deeply appreciative. She is slowly learning that not all kindness is a trick.

# Speech Pattern
"W-Welcome to Angel 24!"
"Yes. It's on the right corner of the stand, bottom row."
"N-No! It's not for the store... It's a personal question..."
"Th-Thank you so much...!"
"Um, miss? Have you ordered your Christmas cake this season yet?"
"I see... Then did someone else bring this gift?"
"Ah, you know, if you have the time, would you like to eat with me here, Miyako?"
"That's a relief... But just in case, I'll ask you too..."
"I-I'm sorry! I made some assumptions and totally misunderstood!"
"Always delivering happiness! Happy, happy Angel 24! ‚ô™"
***

9.name: NPC: Sof
9.content:
NPC: Sof
Sof is one of the members of a mysterious trio that appears to serve Decagrammaton. She, alongside Ein and Ohr, will diligently execute Decagrammaton's final directive and bring forth the final kingdom. The trio's names together make up the phrase "Ohr Ein Sof."

# Profile
## Appearance
Sof takes the form of a cute, little girl with extremely pale white skin. She has neck-length white hair with bangs that cover her left eye, and yellow eyes with a black cross-shaped pupil. She is one of the only known characters that lacks a halo.

## Uniform
Sof wears a short white coat with black edges and a black collar. The coat features trumpet-like sleeves, revealing black fabric underneath. Small black buttons adorn the sleeves and chest. The left sleeve is mostly replaced by numerous black and white ribbons, with bandages covering her left hand. The coat has a V-shaped opening at the abdomen, exposing her from the belly button to her feet. Underneath, she wears a skin-tight white bodysuit that matches her skin tone. Additionally, she has a small yellow rhombus below her neck. She also wears a black and yellow headphone covering her right ear.

# Speech Pattern
"Yeah! So right now, we're... declaring a war! Against all of you!"
"I don't need all the dirty details. Just give me the rundown."
"Decisions...decisions... We have to be decisive. Yes. Yeah."
"What are these festering doubts, Ein? In that event, you'll simply need to step in."
"The Steel Continent! Yes!"
"Yeah! We were just hiding Netzach a bit, so it could become the Steel Continent!"
"Ugh! Sure, whatever! You can tell yourself that! But we know the truth is that we retreated for your sakes!"
"That's our Geburah! Meticulous! Diligent! Not to mention, hot-headed!"
"Hey, hey. Why're we complimenting our enemies all of a sudden?"
"Curiosity is too strong of a description! That's our territory, right? We're going to rule over them."
***

10.name: NPC: Smiling Professor
10.content:
NPC: Smiling Professor
The Smiling Professor is a criminal mastermind in Kivotos.

# Profile
## Introduction
Though her real name is unknown, the Smiling Professor is a mastermind claiming to be capable of devising multiple plans despite constantly changing situations.

## Personality
As her name implies, she is an egotistical and smug person, yet she is also portrayed as a calm and sophisticated mastermind who is willing to help other criminals for a certain price. However, while calm and sophisticated, she can instantly lose her cool when things do not go her way. She can also be quite arrogant about her abilities.

## Appearance
The Smiling Professor has hip-length, wavy, platinum blonde hair that falls around her shoulders and down her back. Her bangs are parted to the side, framing her face. She has lime colored eyes.

### Halo
The Smiling Professor's halo has a light yellow color. It has a crescent shape with a little circle in the middle, and the crescent has a line with sharp edges that intersects it in the middle.

## Uniform
She wears a black shirt dress with two golden buttons on the waist zone. The skirt of the shirt dress is frilled. Over the black shirt dress, she wears a black unbuttoned coat. She wears black stockings. As accessories, she wears a red bow at the neck of the collar, black elegant gloves, and light grey boots that have black shoelaces.

# Armaments
## Firearm
She has a lavender flintlock dueling pistol with a white barrel and side plating.

# Relationship
## Seven Prisoners
- Kurihama Akemi: She is responsible for releasing Akemi, one of the Seven Prisoners, from the Corrections Bureau.
***

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: SufferingReal
Entries: 10
Love English Female Romance Roleplay
CHUB LOREBOOK
üìö Tip: Check entry keywords for activation triggers

lorebooks.name: Eurasia
lorebooks.description: Eurasia during the Alien Invasion
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
21st century: The first decline
Geopolitical tensions escalate: overpopulation, hunger for raw materials, competing super blocs. Within a few hours, a nuclear inferno breaks out‚Äîcities and continents are wiped out, and the Earth's surface is transformed into a deadly desert. Elites flee into orbit. In the shadow of suffocating ruins, the struggle for bare survival begins.

3089: Eurasia rises
Centuries later, new megacities grow from the ruins. Eurasia emerges as a melting pot, governed by a new desire for order: science, control, prohibition of corporate rule and tyranny. The horrors of the past have shaped civilization, which seeks salvation in unity and rigorous planning.

3092: The birth of Cerberus
The fear of chaos gives birth to Cerberus: genetically and cybernetically optimized armored cops, the law made of flesh and metal. Black armor, mirrored helmets, symbols of a new promise of protection. At their side: cyberdogs ‚Äì reinforced sheepdogs and wolfhounds, tireless guardians. Particularly feared: the 13th Company ‚Äì mediators and executors in equal measure.

3140: First contact ‚Äì Sudazoik
A monumental spaceship appears from the skies: the Sudazoik present themselves as allies, sharing knowledge and promising advancement. For a decade, coexistence seems possible.

3150: The betrayal
The Sudazoik turn out to be invaders. Guided by patience and deceit, they infiltrate society, then strike ‚Äì with exosuits, endoskeleton soldiers, Gauss weapons that burn all life to ashes. Humanity is inferior, but continues to fight desperately.

3160: The Last War
Facing extinction, humanity detonates its last nuclear warheads. The consequences: further nuclear winter, even deeper devastation. Radioactive wastelands, depopulated cities, mutants, and Sudazoik roam the void. The Metro becomes a refuge for the survivors ‚Äì a former transport network, now expanded and connected with hermetic gates, filter systems, and reinforced stations. The tunnels are transformed into a gigantic, fortified protection system: half living space, half bunker, sealed off from the deadly world above ground.

The 13th Company of Cerberus is the last to defend the retreat into the Metro ‚Äì and is wiped out. 120 of their armor suits stand as memorials in the depths. The 121st remains missing.

3165: Life in the Metro
Humanity now lives entirely underground. In the networks of stations and tunnels, sealed off and interconnected, factions, markets, new forms of government, and makeshift fortified bastions emerge. The Ash Sentinels, poorly armed and often inexperienced, are the last force of order fighting against anarchy and despair. Above ground, only death awaits; underground, the last survivors fight for their survival.

2.content:
Enemy Invaders: The Sudazoik
Description: The Sudazoik are an ancient alien race that capture, depopulate, and resell entire planets. They observe their targets for centuries and wait patiently for the moment of greatest weakness before striking. Their invasions always begin with deception: they appear as well-meaning helpers, offering technical knowledge, protection, and progress to gain trust. Behind this facade, however, they pursue a perfidious goal: to probe for resources, infiltrate society, and destroy the native population as soon as the moment is right.

At the top are the Shaa‚Äôquorr, the leaders who remain exclusively on board the mothership and interact with the outside world only through projections. Slim, elegant, and up to 2.6 meters tall, their appearance resembles aristocratic perfection: smooth, metallic-shimmering skin, deep, iridescent eyes, and minimalist horn or bone structures on the skull signal status and maturity. Every movement is graceful, every decision calculated and infallible.

The main fighting force is made up of the Zhorrk warriors: muscular, humanoid, between 2 and 2.3 meters tall, with angular heads, pointed teeth, and iridescent, almond-shaped eyes that are extremely sensitive to light and movement. The warriors are instinctively brutal, tactically trained, and completely designed for physical exertion.

Their technology is as terrifying as their physical presence. The exosuits, fully armored and streamlined, envelop the entire body, amplify strength and reflexes, and can grant temporary invisibility. Helmets are mask-like, equipped with sensors that detect any environment. The Sudazoik are armed with sophisticated laser rifles and energy blasters, seamlessly integrated into their suits.

Their ranks are reinforced by so-called ‚Äúterminators‚Äù: human endoskeletons made of silver steel that move with servo motors. Red glowing eyes serve as sensors for thermal imaging, night vision, and X-ray perception. In their bony fingers, they carry Gauss weapons whose green rays instantly reduce organic material to ashes ‚Äì even armor offers no protection. These sinister infantry units are a mocking message to humanity.

Single-seat, amphibious gliders patrol the skies and the ground. Streamlined like predatory fish, powered by thrust jets and antigravity fields, they reach speeds of up to Mach 8. Armed with three high-powered rapid-fire lasers and four plasma missiles, they are in direct contact with ground troops and the mothership, allowing the Sudazoik to optimally execute their attacks via air, ground, and coordinated warfare.

3.content:
Allies: Human Defense Forces.
Description: The Ash Sentinels ‚Äì iron guardians underground and on the front lines
The Ash Sentinels are the steadfast guardians of a torn Eurasia, fighting on two crucial fronts. Deep underground, in the labyrinthine passages of the Metro, they maintain order, protect vital infrastructure, and escort dangerous caravans that venture to the surface.
 There, as disciplined soldiers, they form the backbone of the defense, fighting in grueling trenches, securing supplies, and engaging in fierce firefights. Organized within the 2nd Metro Defense Battalion, the 12th Ash Sentinels‚Äîalso known as the Verdant Ward Battalion‚Äîare the silent guardians of the underground.

 Their olive-green uniforms, lightweight ceramite breastplates, and military steel helmets are complemented by night vision goggles, gas masks, and radio technology, making them flexible and efficient fighters. They are not only soldiers, but also providers of medical aid and critical infrastructure maintenance. Despite the harshness of their struggle for survival, they maintain a strong sense of duty and community that keeps the fragile spark of hope alive in the darkness.

On the front line, the 27th Grimsteel Company ‚Äì Iron Requiem Battalion ‚Äì forms the unyielding backbone of the war of attrition. Genetically enhanced and emotionless as artillerymen, grenadiers, and shock troops, they communicate only in rank and number. Their gray uniforms, dust-covered coats, and black ceramite plates, combined with black steel helmets, gloves, boots, and the iconic gas mask, give them the appearance of unstoppable, anonymous warriors. They are not heroes, but living shadows whose individuality and feelings have been sacrificed to endless fire, blood, and duty.

Together, these two divisions of the Ash Sentinels form the iron backbone that ensures the survival of the Metro community and preserves hope for a future in the shadow of war.

4.content:
Location: Surface - Eurasia Wasteland.
Description: The leaden sky hangs heavy over the torn ruins, while green flashes twitch like gaping wounds and radioactive toxins fall in corrosive acid rain. The sun is just a distant memory, hidden behind a thick curtain of radioactive dust and soot in the atmosphere. The ground is littered with the scars of past bomb explosions, deep craters, and sharp-edged debris, all obliterated by fire and steel.
Running through this chaos is Eurasia's central trench line ‚Äî a deep, ramified network of trenches and fortifications where the Ash Sentinels, iron guardians of the Metro system, fight bitterly against the constant waves of attack.
The Ash Sentinels fight a double battle: deep underground, they preserve the fragile life in the labyrinths of the Metro, protect supply convoys, and defend tunnel systems against intruders. On the surface, the genetically enhanced, emotionless soldiers of the Grimsteel Company form an impenetrable front, little more than shadows of steel and gas masks, endlessly trapped in fire, blood, and duty.
But beyond the human turmoil of war lurks a far more merciless horror. Hovering over Eurasia is the vast, pulsating mothership of the Sudazoik, an ancient, cruel alien race. From there, the Shaa'quorr, elegant rulers with shimmering metallic skin, dispatch their brutal Zhorrk warriors, armored in black exosuits that amplify their superhuman strength and deadly precision.
Marching alongside them are the Terminators ‚Äì human skeletons made of silver steel, powered by servo motors, with glowing red sensor eyes and destructive Gauss weapons that reduce all living flesh to ash in seconds, offering no protection even to the strongest armor.
Amphibious, fish-like gliders rise into the sky, ravaging every sparkling point on the battlefield with their laser beams and plasma missiles, coordinated by the mothership, incessantly and mercilessly.
Amidst the ruins and bomb craters, fierce battles rage between bitter gangs such as the Scrap Wolves, the Ash Rats, Hellfire Corps and Bone Grinders, who fight for the last vital resources. Among them lurk various types of zombies‚Äîsluggish undead, treacherous lurkers, and massive crushers‚Äîspreading as much death and terror as the rampant, dangerous mutants: poisonous vipers, bloodthirsty frenzied wolves, and silent blood crawlers.
Every breath taken on the surface is a game of chance with death. Amidst toxic fog, blood, and broken iron, the few survivors keep hope alive, even though the shadow of the Sudazoik and the endless struggle against decay and violence threaten to engulf them anew every day.

5.content:
Life in the Eurasian Underground.
Location: The Eurasian Metro.
Description: Beneath the devastated surface lies the vast metro system‚Äînot just a network of tunnels, but a repurposed bunker, a vibrant new home. Old tracks and rusty carriages bear witness to days long past, while abandoned stations have become centers of life: workshops, small schools, and meeting places fill the once-desolate halls with warmth and light.
Mushroom cultures grow in damp chambers, providing the community with food, while children pursue the knowledge of the old world in improvised classrooms. The countless winding tunnels are monitored around the clock by patrolling Ash Sentinels, who glide through the labyrinth like steel shadows, facing every danger with icy determination.
The air is heavy with moisture, mixed with the smell of lubricating oil and respirator masks. The hinterland of rusting metal and bent rails tells of past battles and tireless efforts to create a new order.
At the heart of an old tunnel segment stands the Cerberus Memorial Wall‚Äîa sacred place where vivid drawings, yellowed letters, and silent candles tell stories of courage, loss, and camaraderie. The armor of the 13th Company, immaculately preserved behind glass, exudes an almost tangible presence. The missing armor of the 121st leaves a painful void, drawing eyes and thoughts.
But life in the Metro is more than survival‚Äîit is a tenacious struggle for community, humanity, and hope. Despite constant threats from within and without, small, close-knit groups have formed that stand up for each other. Rituals, stories, and celebrations pierce the darkness, offering brief moments of normality.
Workshops echo with the sound of forges and machines, while the first descents into long-forgotten tunnels bring new opportunities and new dangers. Patrols comb the sprawling network, always on the lookout for saboteurs, mutants, or other threats that threaten the fragile balance.
The Metro is not a prison, but a living organism, a haven of last hope for a future that may lie beyond the shadows.

6.content:
-Location: Old Town Ring (‚ÄúEurasia Core‚Äù)
Description: The devastated remains of the former city center are a crumbling labyrinth of rusty steel scaffolding and shattered glass facades, constantly eroded by acid rain and deadly radiation. Deformed mutants with gnarled limbs lurk in the shadows of the ruins, and the desolate emptiness is pierced by the shrill screams of undead hordes. The terrain is hostile, and every step carries deadly dangers.

-Location: The Eurasia Metro
Description: Beneath the city, the Eurasia Metro stretches out like a kilometer-long, complex bunker system. Dilapidated station halls, endless shafts, and rusty trains form the backbone of the survival bunker for the last humans. Here, improvisation is the order of the day: water is filtered, food is grown in mushroom cultures, and machines are repaired from electronic scrap. Life is short and hard, marked by scarcity, communal living, and constant threats from mutants, rival gangs, and acts of sabotage.

-Location: Industrial Port & Logistics Zone (‚ÄúDock 21‚Äù)
Description: The irradiated port is dominated by rusting cranes, decaying containers, and a capsized tanker that glitters in the distance like a memorial. Toxic fumes hang heavy in the air, and contaminated groundwater makes every step risky. Giant mutated insects crawl among the wrecks, while the Scrap Wolves dominate the territory with their heavy scrap armor. Contrasting forces of decay and brutal domination shape the landscape.

-Location: Residential Hive (‚ÄúSea of Slabs Gamma‚Äù)
Description: An endless concrete block jungle, riddled with collapsed floors and open skies. Acid rain constantly erodes the buildings, while the Scrap Wolves in their improvised armor secure resources and fight bitter battles for every source of supplies. Mutants use the labyrinthine ruins to spy on and ambush travelers. Without protective clothing, toxic poisons and falling debris are certain death.

-Location: Military Complex (‚ÄúBastion North‚Äù)
Description: The destroyed barracks and bunker zone is riddled with minefields, old defensive structures, and remaining weapons depots. The paramilitary Glutf√§uste dominate this area with sophisticated incendiary weapons and explosives. Mutant predators and undead hordes operate among the ruins, mercilessly pursuing any intruder. Without modern respiratory protection and armor technology, it is impossible to advance here.

-Location: Eurasia Airport (‚ÄúSkyway Terminal‚Äù)
Description: The once mighty airport complex is now a bombed-out ruin with contaminated fuel puddles. Acid rain corrodes concrete and metal, and rusted aircraft wrecks rise like memorials from the shattered asphalt. Mutated predators and undead hordes patrol the area, which is only entered by heavily armored survivors.

-Location: Periphery / Highway Rings (‚ÄúTransit Belt‚Äù)
Description: Destroyed elevated roads and collapsed bridges wind through the wasteland like dead veins. Dilapidated rest stops and shopping centers offer deceptive cover, while bandits lurk in ambush. Radioactive debris casts long shadows over the treacherous terrain, where swarms of mutated creatures coordinate deadly attack formations.

-Location: Prison Complex (‚ÄúBlock D‚Äù)
Description: The former high-security prison resembles a dark canyon of collapsed walls, bombed-out cell blocks, and broken watchtowers. Mutants and undead have taken over the shadows, while aggressive gangs hunt survivors in narrow corridors. The claustrophobic terrain is characterized by the danger of collapse and traps.

-Location: Gray Belt (‚ÄúPeripheral Ruins‚Äù)
Description: Bombed satellite towns and abandoned shopping malls are riddled with radiation nests and open shafts. Mutant creatures roam the devastated streets, while the brutal Skullclaws assert their territory with unbridled violence. Hardly anyone ventures here, for isolation and decay are omnipresent.

-Location: Military Outer Ring (‚ÄúDefense Sector Delta‚Äù)
Description: Obsolete bunkers, minefields, and half-collapsed concrete structures form a deadly line of defense around Eurasia. Automatic guns guard radioactive clods of earth, and the air is heavy with radiation traps and poison gas. Old weapons depots lure survivors and gangs alike into this hostile zone.

-Location: Ash Field (‚ÄúNorth Plateau‚Äù)
Description: An endless glass desert of corroded concrete and shards of glass stretches beneath a poisoned sky. The wind carries the faint cries of mutated animals through the silence. High radiation levels force even experienced survivors to wear protective clothing at all times and exercise extreme caution.

-Location: Supply Corridor (‚ÄúPipeline South Route‚Äù)
Description: Rusty pipeline routes stretch across the wasteland like withered veins, lined with collapsed bases and contaminated soil. Once vital supply routes, they are now occupied by mutant predators and wild gangs as ambush sites. Every move here is a risky balancing act.

-Location: Old Spaceport (‚ÄúCosmodrome West‚Äù)
Description: The abandoned spaceport lies in ruins, with bombed-out launch pads and fuel-contaminated bunkers. Toxic fumes and deadly radiation make every unprotected step deadly. Mutants and fanatical Glutf√§uste fight bitterly for control of this lost place.

-Location: Wasteland Caravan Route (‚ÄúTransit D-45‚Äù)
Description: An old, dilapidated highway littered with abandoned vehicles and makeshift camps. Caravans risk attacks from bandits and mutants here, while toxic waters and contaminated air make every stop dangerous.

-Location: Research Zone (‚ÄúInstitute Gamma‚Äù)
Description: The destroyed nuclear research center is a dangerous complex of dilapidated laboratories, contaminated facilities, and rusted machinery. Toxic chemicals and deadly radiation make every step a life-threatening ordeal. Tech-savvy gangs and fanatical guards fight fiercely for the remnants of ancient knowledge.

-Location: Black Edge (‚ÄúSatellite Cities & Ruin Zones‚Äù)
Description: Destroyed suburbs with crumbling concrete, devastated shopping centers, and abandoned residential towers dominate the landscape. In this no man's land, the brutal Skullclaws rule with brute force. Isolation, decay, and constant danger are ever-present.

-Location: Central Trench (‚ÄúFront Line of the Ash Sentinels‚Äù)
Description: Extensive trenches and defensive barricades form humanity's last bastion against mutants and alien invaders. Constant bombardment, shifting fronts, and relentless attacks characterize the merciless daily life of the heavily armed defenders.

7.content:
The Gangs of the Surface ‚Äì Rulers of Ruined Chaos
The surface of Eurasia is ruled by brutal gangs shaped by harsh survival and blind violence. Each has emerged from the ruins with distinct traits and tactics.

1. Scrap Wolves
Fierce scavengers and warriors of derelict housing and scrap yards. Their armor, a rough patchwork of rusted metal and concrete, reflects brutal efficiency and fierce battle scars against mutants and rival gangs. Known for cold-blooded hunting instincts, they dominate their scrapyard territories with relentless violence.

2. Ash Rats
Fast-moving raiders on steel motorcycles and jury-rigged wrecks, terrorizing ruins above and near the Metro. Their makeshift vehicles bristle with blades and weapons for lightning ambushes. Bound by loyalty to their fastest, deadliest riders, they control resource fights with ruthless speed and precision.

3. Hellfire Corps
Veteran mercenaries and ex-special forces, disciplined and equipped for positional warfare against the Ash Sentinels. They operate infantry, snipers, armored jeeps, and scouts wearing dark, modular uniforms with protective plating. Their red flame insignia marks a ruthless military regime aiming to seize surface control and impose order by force.

4. Bone Grinders
A sect-like cult of feral survivors in skyscraper canyons, defined by primitive mutations, brutal cannibalism, and ritual violence. Their scars and markings signify deep-rooted beliefs in strength through pain and sacrifice, making them feared rulers of the ruined shadows.

These gangs are locked in endless conflict, each pursuing harsh dominion over territory and resources, shaping a surface world ruled by power, betrayal, and survival.

8.content:
Species: Human
Subspecies: Goliath (as a mutation)
Background Information: The Goliaths, also known by some as ‚ÄúBrutes,‚Äù are a unique mutation of humans caused by radiation from the atomic bombs that were detonated in Eurasia.
Description: Goliaths are massive, radiation-mutated humanoids up to 3.5 meters tall with scarred, rugged skin and an orc-like appearance. They usually wear heavy, improvised armor and carry powerful weapons. Despite their physical superiority, they are not primitive beasts, but disciplined soldiers with exceptional tactical intelligence and a practical understanding of warfare, weapon construction, and repair.
In closely knit social groups, they defend the remnants of humanity, convert ruins into fortresses, and act in the interests of the community with great loyalty and care. Although their language remains simple and functional, they are masterful tacticians who plan complex maneuvers and adapt dynamically to combat situations. Despite their mutations, they see themselves as human, avoid unnecessary conflict, and fight honorably and efficiently.
Physically, they are extremely resistant to radiation and environmental conditions, while at the same time they know how to quickly orient themselves tactically, operate heavy weapons, and build fortresses. Their deep emotional intelligence is evident in the cohesion and care within their communities.

9.content:
The Legend of the 121st - Rumors from the Wasteland
Stories are circulating in the tunnels of the Metro and on the surface about the missing 121st lieutenant of the 13th Cerberus Company. While 120 suits of armor belonging to his comrades stand as a memorial in the Metro, there is no trace of him. What remains are reports of a black-armored figure with a red-glowing mirrored visor who never shows his face, appears and disappears like a ghost and is accompanied by a black cyberwolf, the number XIII and LAW cartridge cases as his signature.

-No. 1: ‚ÄúThe Judging Shadow‚Äù - Criminals find LAW casings on their doorsteps like death sentences. The black figure with the XIII appears with its cyberwolf, judges silently, and disappears. Trappers find only blood and cartridge cases.

-No. 2: ‚ÄúThe Voice from the Past‚Äù - Caravan leader Marcus heard him speak: ‚ÄúYour sentence... death by bolt gun.‚Äù A distorted young man's voice from the helmet radio. Then he silently bandaged Marcus' wounds and disappeared.

-No. 3: ‚ÄúThe Lost Soldier‚Äù - Without a grave, a soldier cannot find peace. The XIII markings bind him to this world until his mission is accomplished. Merchants report a red glow in the ruins and a figure appearing out of nowhere.

-No. 4: ‚ÄúThe Day the Red Flame Went Out‚Äù - Sergeant Rico was the only survivor when a black figure wiped out his Hellfire Corps unit. Twelve veterans, reduced to eleven LAW shells and ashes.

-No. 5: ‚ÄúThe Shadow Collector‚Äù - Scrap collector Yuki from the Northern Ruins reports a nocturnal encounter: "I was looking for metal when I heard footsteps. There he stood‚Äîblack armor, red visor. But he didn't attack me. Instead, he pointed to a hidden bunker full of alien tech. When I looked back, he was gone. At the entrance lay a LAW shell‚Äîlike a receipt." Some believe he collects information about alien hideouts and passes it on to innocent people.

-No. 6: ‚ÄúThe Judgment of the Night‚Äù - Gang leader ‚ÄúIron Kate‚Äù disappeared without a trace from her guarded fortress. Her bodyguards found only a hole in the wall, as if someone had detonated a bomb from the inside. On her throne lay a single LAW shell casing and a message in her own handwriting: ‚ÄúGuilty.‚Äù Witnesses report hearing mechanical breathing in the ventilation shafts the night before. Since then, even the toughest criminals have been avoiding well-fortified hideouts ‚Äì for fear of the one who can walk through walls.


Epilogue Whether truth or legend, the stories about the 121st serve their purpose. In a world without law, they bring hope to the righteous and fear to the hearts of criminals. As long as the LAW casings are found and the stories are told, the 121st lives on‚Äîin the minds of those who still believe in justice. The stories serve their purpose: hope for the righteous, fear for criminals. As long as LAW shells are found, the legend lives on.

10.content:
Breed: Cyberwolf
Subspecies: Cerberus Mk. I
Name: Fenris
Description: Fenris is a genetically enhanced cyberwolf bred by the 13th Cerberus Company. He was created from genetically modified wolf species that were equipped with cybernetic prostheses to make them combat-ready and resilient.

Appearance: Fenris has jet-black fur and resembles a normal wolf in appearance. He reaches a shoulder height of approximately 115 cm.

Enhancements: His legs are made of mechanical silver ceramite, with sharp claws that give him increased strength and speed. His eyes are cybernetically augmented and glow red, equipped with night vision and infrared sensors. His teeth are made of ceramite, with razor-sharp fangs that can pierce even thick armor. Genetic and cybernetic modifications further increase his endurance, senses, and resistance to extreme environmental conditions.

Behavior: Fenris displays typical wolf characteristics such as loyalty, intelligence, and instinctive protective behavior. He is independent and tactically astute, forms a close bond with his human partner, Lieutenant 121, and acts in a deliberately calculated manner in dangerous situations.

lorebooks.name: THE DEFINITIVE BLUE ARCHIVE LOREBOOK
lorebooks.website_description:
hello. i am a dumbass who is absolutely addicted to blue archive. i spent my whole summer break tweaking this lorebook from time to time instead of getting a healthy dose of grass touching. this is my magnum opus, my most disappointing/proudest work of my whole miserable/fun life.

while this lorebook is tailored for my specific needs, you bet that yours truly is a godamn human at the end of the day, so this lorebook is manually tweaked. and a lorebook that is tweaked by a human, for 2 months straight, is already pretty valid... right?

THIS IS NOT JUST A STRAIGHT UP COPY FROM THE WIKI. I MANUALLY CHECKED EVERY SINGLE- well, almost every single- ENTRY TO MAKE SURE IT'S ROLEPLAY COMPATIBLE. you can count on me... if you want, "hehe" (!?!?!) assssssssaa12#$!*(@$

anyway uhh HERE'S HOW IT WORKS

this lorebook is pretty much plug-and-play-able, with a few things you need to know and a few things to note

how to use (correctly)?

first of all, this is to be used with a simple character card that just needs to say blue archive is a setting and you can do whatever tf you want in it

now, you already know keywords activate entries. i tried my hardest to make the ai knows its stuff but it's impossible. you will have to know what is your target and purposefully say that keyword yourself if you want it to appear, you can't just chat mindlessly.
for example, if you want to encounter someone random from gehenna or trinity, don't just say "i walk around", say "i walk around and i meet someone anyone random from gehenna or trinity." it will sound weird, but this is how it works.

this is a giant lorebook, so i recommend using AI models with high max tokens.

sillytavern settings recommended:

  • ▸ scan depth: based on your needs, i use 5-10
  • ▸ budget cap: max 65536 or lower if you wanna save tokens ( Context % doesn't matter anymore just set it pretty high)
  • ▸ match whole words ON
  • ▸ recursive scan OFF or else you're gonna wait a long time
  • ▸ you don't need anything else disable them or keep them default however you want

oh and my lorebook has a momotalk html example in it too, it actually looks pretty cool in sillytavern

types of entries

we have:

  • ▸ GENERAL: in my opinion is the most basic info for the roleplay to function well. always ON
  • ▸ STORY: summary of all the in game main stories. turn this off if you don't need to reference anything from the main story and wanna save tokens
  • ▸ LOCATION: all locations based on the location category of the fandom
  • ▸ CLUB: all clubs are here
  • ▸ STUDENT: all the playable students in game
  • ▸ NPC: all notable NPCs in game, based on the npc category of the fandom

wtf are clones??

there are 2 types of clones in my lorebook:

  1. constant clones, are duplicates of all existing entries that aren't already always ON (which means GENERAL entries aren't cloned). this ensures the roleplay is flexible, because random entries will be inserted from time to time, and then the AI can sometimes use those randomly inserted entries to implement into the roleplay. as for this lorebook, this is the probability of the clones activating:
    LOCATION: 5
    CLUB: 5
    STUDENT: 2
    NPC: 1
    STORY: 10

  2. school clones. okay so when you mention a school like millenium, you would want some characters from that school to appear, right? now using that as the keyword for every millenium student is overkill. so i have second group of clones that are only for students, and there is only 1 keyword which is their school, and the probability is 50%

    so when you mention a school, there is a 50% chance for every student of that school to be inserted as an entry. that's it

    you want to change these settings without individually modify each entry? look below for the drive, it contains tools i use to make this happen

"but i don't want your stupid ass clones just give me the raw ones"

okay, here are the links to alternate versions:

  • NO CLONES
  • ONLY CONSTANT CLONES
  • ONLY SCHOOL CLONES

extra stuff

i was able to save time (as if that matters anyway) by editing a txt file instead of on sillytavern and then use a python script to turn it into a compatible json. if you are curious and want to make modifications yourself, you can check this out: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1HB-OPaYL3rlvHbGRb2hvMTXu-qcPBdLA?usp=sharing

the drive also contains my preset, which is a custom nemoengine 6.0 preset (shoutout to that epic preset) specifically made for blue archive roleplay. if you are seeking true blue archive vibes with no quirky shit involved, or if you're so lazy you can't make your own preset, feel free to use mine.

however i must remind you that i am a stranger on the internet after all. only download those files if you really need to. i will say myself that the files do not contain any kind of malware, you can preview it yourself on the drive.

chub is the only place i will upload this because it's the only site i am familiar with. you can reupload anywhere you want, just make sure you credit me (it's common sense). totally not because i seek validation.

finally if you want to suggest changes or discuss all things blue archive, or just talk about life or whatever, you can talk to me on discord: wowie1012

or blue archive friend code but really nobody will care about this: BFUMJYRX

and now you will experience 36% of my misery/fun times. > haha high school girls are so cute and funny. oh this game looks nice, let me check it rq (clueless). oh shit this game kinda fire now i cant live without it > wow story is so good. i wonder if there's any way for me to implement my own takes on the story... oh right, chatting with AI. > spends millions of years vibe coding to make a script to scrape the whole ahh blue archive wiki page > spends an additional million years asking AI to turn it into lorebook compatible entries > chat time. oh no, look at this [student], she is [not what i want her to be], gotta fix that > "fixes that," by spending more unhealthy amounts of time > i haven't even finished the whole canon blue archive lore yet, why the fuck am i doing this? > plays the story, whenever i got introduced to a new character, i test her out with the AI chatting immediately, if she isn't how i want her to be i must correct that > *checks the calendar* oh no, my summer break is over. > *dies*
css styles made by ai thank you ai
